original: gang shing s'a la chen po de char pa chen po bab ste gsher cing brlan par gyur na slar yang skye zhing yal ga dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dag kyang 'byung la /
analyzed: gang shing s'a la chen po de char pa chen po bab ste gsher cing brlan par gyur na slar yang skye zhing yal ga dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dag kyang 'byung la /
translated: when that great sāla tree is watered by a great rain and becomes moist, it grows again with branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

analyzed: gang sems can thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dus dang / de lta bu'i skabs kyang yod do //

original: btsun pa rab 'byor; de bzhin du byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen pos gsher cing brlan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes la khams gsum du'ang skye zhing gang sems can thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ba tshe dang /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor; de bzhin du byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen pos gsher cing brlan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes la khams gsum du'ang skye zhing gang sems can thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ba tshe dang /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, in the same way, a bodhisattva who is moistened and saturated with great love and great compassion understands the view of the transitory collection, and is born in the three realms, and also manifests life,

original: rigs dang / skye ba'ang ston par byed do //
analyzed: rigs dang / skye ba'ang ston par byed do //
translated: lineage, and birth, which become the very sustenance of all sentient beings.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

analyzed: gang shing s'a la chen po de @396b rlung chen po'i shugs kyis phul nas la ltung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dus dang / de lta bu'i skabs kyang yod do //
translated: there are times and occasions when that great sāla tree is uprooted by the force of a great wind and falls down.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes chen po'i rlung gi shugs kyis phul na byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po 'gog par ltung ngo //
translated: in the same way, when a bodhisattva is uprooted by the force of the great wind of wisdom, he falls into the cessation of the essence of enlightenment.🔽Then the Blessed One expressed his approval to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: “Excellent, Mañjuśrī!

analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs dang shes rab kyis yang dag par zin pa'i ye shes kyi dbyings dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i chos bstan pa de ni legs par bshad de /
translated: Mañjuśrī, you have well explained the realm of wisdom, which is embraced by the method and wisdom of bodhisattvas, and the Dharma that is endowed with great love and great compassion.

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: Excellent, excellent!

original: 'jam dpal / 'on kyang dpe gang dag bstan pas byang chub sems dpa'i thabs dang shes rab shes par 'gyur pa'i dpe ngas kyang bstan gyi /🔽nyon cig / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'on kyang dpe gang dag bstan pas byang chub sems dpa'i thabs dang shes rab shes par 'gyur pa'i dpe ngas kyang bstan gyi / nyon cig / 'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī, I will also teach the parables that cause the wisdom of the method and wisdom of bodhisattvas to be known.🔽Listen!

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / klu'i rgyal po mthu dang ldan pas sems dpa'i dbang gis sprin gyi phung po gcig las char pa'i bdag nyid dang / glog gi phreng ba'ang gtong ngo //
analyzed: dper na / klu'i rgyal po mthu dang ldan pas sems dpa'i dbang gis sprin gyi phung po gcig las char pa'i bdag nyid dang / glog gi phreng ba'ang gtong ngo //
translated: For example, a powerful nāga king, by the power of his mind, emits from a single cloud the nature of rain and a garland of lightning.

original: skye bar byed pa'i bdag nyid chu'i rgyun kyang gtong ngo //
analyzed: skye bar byed pa'i bdag nyid chu'i rgyun kyang gtong ngo //
translated: He also emits a stream of water that has the nature of producing.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang thabs dang shes rab dang / ye shes kyi sprin gcig las sems can so so'i skye bo rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi spyod pa'ang ston to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang thabs dang shes rab dang / ye shes kyi sprin gcig las sems can so so'i skye bo rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi spyod pa'ang ston to //
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva, from the single cloud of his skillful means, insight, and pristine awareness, causes the rain of the Dharma to fall for the maturation of the various ordinary beings.

original: gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams @397a *//
analyzed: gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams @397a *//
translated: For the sake of taming sentient beings,

original: gdul ba'i phyir 'phags pa thams cad kyi spyod pa'ang ston to //
analyzed: gdul ba'i phyir 'phags pa thams cad kyi spyod pa'ang ston to //
translated: he displays the conduct of all the noble ones.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / ri'i rgyal po gangs ri la dri'i shing zhig yod de /🔽de'i rtsa ba'i dri'ang gzhan /
analyzed: dper na / ri'i rgyal po gangs ri la dri'i shing zhig yod de / de'i rtsa ba'i dri'ang gzhan /
translated: On the king of mountains, Mount Sumeru, there is a tree called gandhapādapa.🔽The fragrance of its roots is one thing,

original: sdong po'i dri'ang gzhan /🔽yal ga'i dri'ang gzhan /🔽lo ma'i dri'ang gzhan /
analyzed: sdong po'i dri'ang gzhan / yal ga'i dri'ang gzhan / lo ma'i dri'ang gzhan /
translated: the fragrance of its trunk is another,🔽the fragrance of its branches is another,🔽the fragrance of its leaves is another,

original: me tog gi dri'ang gzhan /
analyzed: me tog gi dri'ang gzhan /
translated: the fragrance of its flowers is another,

original: 'bras bu'i dri'ang gzhan no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dri'ang gzhan no //
translated: and the fragrance of its fruits is another.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du dri'i shing lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa'i lus de'ang sems can rnams ji ltar mos pa bzhin du so so ci rigs par chos kyi dri gtong ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du dri'i shing lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa'i lus de'ang sems can rnams ji ltar mos pa bzhin du so so ci rigs par chos kyi dri gtong ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the body of the bodhisattva, which is like a fragrant tree, emits the fragrance of the Dharma in accordance with the aspirations of sentient beings, in whatever way is appropriate for them.

original: snying rje chen po'i rtsa ba'i dri de las kyang mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i rtsa ba'i dri de las kyang mi g-yo'o //
translated: But it does not move from the fragrance of great compassion.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / brgya byin thogs pa'i nor bu rin po che lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi mgul du thogs na /
analyzed: dper na / brgya byin thogs pa'i nor bu rin po che lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi mgul du thogs na /
translated: When the precious gem worn by Śakra, Lord of the Gods, is placed on his neck,

original: de la sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas thams cad dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi dga' ba dang / rtse ba'i tshogs thams cad snang yang nor bu rin po che de ni rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: de la sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas thams cad dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi dga' ba dang / rtse ba'i tshogs thams cad snang yang nor bu rin po che de ni rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: it illuminates the entire realm of the Thirty-Three Gods and all the gatherings of Śakra’s joy and play, yet that precious gem is nonconceptual.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du nor bu rin po che dag pa lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi dbyings de'ang bya ba thams cad kyang ston la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du nor bu rin po che dag pa lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi dbyings de'ang bya ba thams cad kyang ston la /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the realm of wisdom of the bodhisattva, which is like a pure precious gem, displays all activities

original: thams cad du'ang rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: thams cad du'ang rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: He is also nonconceptual in all respects.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na; nor bu rin po che yid bzhin du 'gro ba zhes bya ba zhig yod de /
analyzed: dper na; nor bu rin po che yid bzhin du 'gro ba zhes bya ba zhig yod de /
translated: There is a jewel called “going to the wishes of beings.”

original: de ni sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par byed kyang nor bu rin po che de ni @397b rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: de ni sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par byed kyang nor bu rin po che de ni @397b rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: It fulfills the wishes of all beings just as they desire, yet that jewel is nonconceptual.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du nor bu rin po che lta bur lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su rdzogs par byed kyang byang chub sems dpa' de ni rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du nor bu rin po che lta bur lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su rdzogs par byed kyang byang chub sems dpa' de ni rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, a bodhisattva whose superior intention is pure, who is like a jewel, fulfills the wishes of all beings just as they desire, yet that bodhisattva is nonconceptual.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / nam mkha' la me'ang 'bar zhing char pa'ang 'bab mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' la me'ang 'bar zhing char pa'ang 'bab mod kyi /
translated: Fire burns and rain falls in the sky,

original: nam mkha' la ni tsha ba'ang med /
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni tsha ba'ang med /
translated: but the sky is neither hot

original: grang bar 'gyur ba'ang med do //
analyzed: grang bar 'gyur ba'ang med do //
translated: nor cold.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du thabs mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang kun tu 'bar ba'i khams gsum na'ang gnas shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i zhi ba la'ang spyod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du thabs mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang kun tu 'bar ba'i khams gsum na'ang gnas shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i zhi ba la'ang spyod mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva who is skilled in means dwells in the three realms that are ablaze, and yet he experiences the peace of nirvāṇa.

original: tsha ba'ang med /
analyzed: tsha ba'ang med /
translated: He is not burned,

original: grang bar 'gyur ba'ang med do //
analyzed: grang bar 'gyur ba'ang med do //
translated: and he does not become cold.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / nam mkha' la dug gi shing yang skye /
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' la dug gi shing yang skye /
translated: poisonous trees grow in the sky,

original: sman gyi shing yang skye mod kyi /
analyzed: sman gyi shing yang skye mod kyi /
translated: and medicinal trees grow in the sky.

original: nam mkha' la ni dug gi shing gis nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni dug gi shing gis nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: The poisonous trees do not afflict the sky,

original: sman gyi shing gis rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sman gyi shing gis rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the medicinal trees do not purify the sky.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du thabs mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang dug gi shing lta bu'i phung po'ang 'chang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du thabs mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang dug gi shing lta bu'i phung po'ang 'chang /
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva who is skilled in means possesses the aggregates that are like poisonous trees,

original: sman gyi shing lta bu'i dbang po'ang 'chang mod kyi /
analyzed: sman gyi shing lta bu'i dbang po'ang 'chang mod kyi /
translated: and he possesses the faculties that are like medicinal trees.🔽The afflictions of the aggregates do not afflict him,

original: phung po'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: phung po'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: and

original: rnam par dag pa'i dbang pos rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dbang pos rnam par byang bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: The pure faculty does not cause purification,

original: gnyis ka'i bya ba'ang byed do //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bya ba'ang byed do //
translated: but it also performs the function of both.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / chu'i snod bu gu brgya yod pa la /
analyzed: dper na / chu'i snod bu gu brgya yod pa la /
translated: Suppose there is a water pot with a hundred holes.

original: @398a *// bu gu gcig bkag na thams cad nas mi 'dzag go /
analyzed: @398a *// bu gu gcig bkag na thams cad nas mi 'dzag go /
translated: If one hole is blocked, the water does not leak out.

original: bu gu gcig bye na thams cad nas kyang 'dzag go /
analyzed: bu gu gcig bye na thams cad nas kyang 'dzag go /
translated: If one hole is opened, the water leaks out.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' mnyam par bzhag pa'i tshe mngon par shes pa chen po la yongs su rdzogs par byed kyi yul la mi 'dzag go /🔽yang langs pa na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' mnyam par bzhag pa'i tshe mngon par shes pa chen po la yongs su rdzogs par byed kyi yul la mi 'dzag go / yang langs pa na 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, likewise, when the bodhisattva is in equipoise, he perfects the great superknowledges but does not leak out to objects.

original: sems can thams cad la so so ji ltar 'os pa chos bstan pa'i phyir yul thams cad du zag go /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la so so ji ltar 'os pa chos bstan pa'i phyir yul thams cad du zag go /
translated: When he rises up, he leaks out to all objects in order to teach the Dharma to all sentient beings, each according to their needs.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / mchog tu mthu dang ldan pa'i rta cang shes ni rta zhon pa la srung bar byed de /
analyzed: dper na / mchog tu mthu dang ldan pa'i rta cang shes ni rta zhon pa la srung bar byed de /
translated: A well-trained horse protects the rider,🔽but I am not like that.

original: bdag la ni de lta ma yin no; ;'jam dpal /
analyzed: bdag la ni de lta ma yin no; ;'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: de bzhin du snying rje chen po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mchog tu mthu dang ldan pa dag ni sems can rnams la srung bar byed de /🔽bdag la ni de lta ma yin no; ;'jam dpal /
analyzed: de bzhin du snying rje chen po thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mchog tu mthu dang ldan pa dag ni sems can rnams la srung bar byed de / bdag la ni de lta ma yin no; ;'jam dpal /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattvas who have attained great compassion are very powerful and protect sentient beings.🔽But I am not like that.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / ri dvags kyi rgyal po seng ge ni me 'bar ba ma gtogs par cis kyang mi 'jigs so //
analyzed: dper na / ri dvags kyi rgyal po seng ge ni me 'bar ba ma gtogs par cis kyang mi 'jigs so //
translated: the lion, king of beasts, is unafraid of anything except a blazing fire.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ba ma gtogs par cis kyang mi 'jigs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ba ma gtogs par cis kyang mi 'jigs so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the bodhisattva is unafraid of anything except the fall into the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / bal glang gi rgyal pos srung gi bu ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na / bal glang gi rgyal pos srung gi bu ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs mod kyi /
translated: the son of the king of elephants, though he belongs to the animal realm,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi bsod nams bsags pa'i phyir dga' ba dang rtse ba'i tshogs @398b thams cad so so ci rigs par ston to //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi bsod nams bsags pa'i phyir dga' ba dang rtse ba'i tshogs @398b thams cad so so ci rigs par ston to //
translated: He manifests all the assemblies of joy and play for the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three and for Śakra, Lord of the Gods, in order to increase their merit.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, even though a bodhisattva has gone to the animal realm,

original: sems can rnams so so ci rigs par yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi tshogs thams cad ston to //
analyzed: sems can rnams so so ci rigs par yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi tshogs thams cad ston to //
translated: he manifests all the assemblies of Dharma for the sake of ripening beings, each in accordance with his needs.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / gang gtsub stan las byung ba dang / gang nor bu rin po che las byung ba'i me de gnyis ka'ang tsha ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dper na / gang gtsub stan las byung ba dang / gang nor bu rin po che las byung ba'i me de gnyis ka'ang tsha ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The fire that arises from friction and the fire that arises from a precious gem both have the nature of heat.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' gang sems dang po bskyed pa dang / gang byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i sems tha ma bskye pa de gnyis ka'ang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa sreg pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' gang sems dang po bskyed pa dang / gang byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i sems tha ma bskye pa de gnyis ka'ang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa sreg pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the two minds—the first generation of the mind of awakening and the last generation of the mind of awakening when seated at the site of awakening—both have the nature of burning away the afflictions of sentient beings.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / dri'i shing sna tshogs rnams ni de dag thams cad khams bzhis yongs su bzung ste skye'o //
analyzed: dper na / dri'i shing sna tshogs rnams ni de dag thams cad khams bzhis yongs su bzung ste skye'o //
translated: various aromatic woods are all held within the four elements and grow.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs kyi tshogs bsags pa de dag thams cad kyang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs kyi tshogs bsags pa de dag thams cad kyang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, all those accumulations of various roots of virtue of bodhisattvas

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis yongs su bzung zhing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsngos na skye'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis yongs su bzung zhing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsngos na skye'o //
translated: grow when they are held within the mind of awakening and dedicated to omniscience.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'khor lo rin po che gang du 'gro ba der 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dpung gi tshogs thams cad 'dong ngo //🔽'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i thabs dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu @399a *//
analyzed: dper na / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'khor lo rin po che gang du 'gro ba der 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dpung gi tshogs thams cad 'dong ngo // 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i thabs dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu @399a *//
translated: For example, Mañjuśrī, wherever the precious wheel of a wheel-turning king goes, there the entire army of the wheel-turning king goes.

original: phyin pa gang du 'gro ba der byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad 'dong ngo //
analyzed: phyin pa gang du 'gro ba der byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad 'dong ngo //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, wherever the perfection of wisdom endowed with skillful means of a bodhisattva goes, there all the factors of awakening of the bodhisattva go.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / bya'i rgyal po ka la pingka'i phrug gu sgo nga'i sbubs na 'dug pa sgo nga mi chag cing sbubs nas ma byung yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dper na / bya'i rgyal po ka la pingka'i phrug gu sgo nga'i sbubs na 'dug pa sgo nga mi chag cing sbubs nas ma byung yang 'di lta ste /
translated: For example, Mañjuśrī, a young bird of the kalaviṅka bird, while still in the egg, without breaking out of the egg, without emerging from the egg,

original: sgra yid du 'ong ba ka la pingka'i sgra nyid sgrogs so //
analyzed: sgra yid du 'ong ba ka la pingka'i sgra nyid sgrogs so //
translated: utters the kalaviṅka’s pleasant sound.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs su zhugs pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs su zhugs pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, a bodhisattva who has entered the egg of ignorance,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma bcom pa /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma bcom pa /
translated: who has not destroyed the view of the transitory collection,

original: khams gsum nas mngon par ma byung yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khams gsum nas mngon par ma byung yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Even though they have not emerged from the three realms, they proclaim the following sounds:

original: sgra stong pa nyid dang; mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sgra nyid sgrogs so //
analyzed: sgra stong pa nyid dang; mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sgra nyid sgrogs so //
translated: the sound of emptiness, the sound of signlessness, the sound of wishlessness, the sound of non-performance, and the sound of the qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / ka la pingka rma bya'i nang du song na ka la pingka'i sgra mi sgrogs so //
analyzed: dper na / ka la pingka rma bya'i nang du song na ka la pingka'i sgra mi sgrogs so //
translated: when a kalaviṅka bird enters the nest of a peacock, it does not proclaim the sound of a kalaviṅka.

original: ka la pingka'i nang du song na ni ka la pingka'i sgra sgrogs so //
analyzed: ka la pingka'i nang du song na ni ka la pingka'i sgra sgrogs so //
translated: But when it enters the nest of a kalaviṅka, it proclaims the sound of a kalaviṅka.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi nang du song na sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sgra mi sgrogs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi nang du song na sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sgra mi sgrogs so //
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, when a bodhisattva enters the midst of hearers and solitary buddhas, it does not proclaim the sound of the inconceivable qualities of the Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nang du song na ni sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sgra sgrogs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nang du song na ni sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sgra sgrogs so //
translated: But when it enters the midst of bodhisattvas, it proclaims the sound of the inconceivable qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / rnam par 'thor rlung ni dzambu'i gling gi shing ngam /
analyzed: dper na / rnam par 'thor rlung ni dzambu'i gling gi shing ngam /
translated: the wind that scatters and disperses cannot be endured by the trees,

original: khang pa'am / gzhal med khang ngam /🔽sa @399b phyogs rnams kyis bzod par mi nus so //
analyzed: khang pa'am / gzhal med khang ngam / sa @399b phyogs rnams kyis bzod par mi nus so //
translated: houses, palaces,🔽or the ground of Jambudvīpa.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams yongs su sgrogs pa na sangs rgyas kyi byin kyi rlabs kyis byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mos pa'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams yongs su sgrogs pa na sangs rgyas kyi byin kyi rlabs kyis byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mos pa'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, when the inconceivable Dharma of the Buddha is being taught to the bodhisattvas, the hearers and solitary buddhas who are not empowered by the Buddha’s blessing cannot have faith in it

original: dad par mi nus te /
analyzed: dad par mi nus te /
translated: or have confidence in it.

original: gang dag sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa de dag ni mos shing yid ches so //
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa de dag ni mos shing yid ches so //
translated: Those who are empowered by the Buddha’s blessing have faith in it and have confidence in it.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / nyi ma'i 'od ni gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang ba gnyis ka la 'char mod kyi /🔽gtsang ba la'ang rjes su chags par mi byed /
analyzed: dper na / nyi ma'i 'od ni gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang ba gnyis ka la 'char mod kyi / gtsang ba la'ang rjes su chags par mi byed /
translated: The light of the sun shines on both the pure and the impure,🔽but it does not have attachment to the pure

original: mi gtsang ba la'ang khong khro bar mi byed de /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la'ang khong khro bar mi byed de /
translated: or aversion to the impure.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni gang du'ang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni gang du'ang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The orb of the sun is not to be described as anything.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi 'od zer kyang nyan thos dang / so so'i skye bo la 'char mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi 'od zer kyang nyan thos dang / so so'i skye bo la 'char mod kyi /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the light rays of a bodhisattva’s wisdom do shine on the hearers and ordinary people,

original: nyan thos rnams la rjes su chags par yang mi byed /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la rjes su chags par yang mi byed /
translated: but they do not become attached to the hearers,

original: so so'i skye bo rnams la khong khro bar yang mi byed /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams la khong khro bar yang mi byed /
translated: and they do not become angry with ordinary people.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gang du'ang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gang du'ang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: A bodhisattva is not to be described as anything.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / nam shing yongs 'dus brtol gyi lo ma lhags par gyur pa de'i tshe sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams ring por mi thogs par shing yongs 'du sa brtol 'di me tog dang / 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro snyam nas yid dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / nam shing yongs 'dus brtol gyi lo ma lhags par gyur pa de'i tshe sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams ring por mi thogs par shing yongs 'du sa brtol 'di me tog dang / 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro snyam nas yid dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, when the leaves of the pārijāta tree in the Heaven of the Thirty-­Three fall, the gods know that before long the pārijāta tree will be in full flower and fruit, and they are delighted.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du nam byang chub sems @400a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du nam byang chub sems @400a *//
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, when bodhisattvas

original: dpa' bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong bar gyur pa de'i tshe ring por mi thogs par byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi me tog dang / 'bras bu sbyin par 'gyur ro zhes sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bstod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpa' bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong bar gyur pa de'i tshe ring por mi thogs par byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi me tog dang / 'bras bu sbyin par 'gyur ro zhes sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bstod par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the Blessed Buddhas will praise the bodhisattva, saying, ‘This bodhisattva will not delay in giving the flowers and fruits of the Buddha’s Dharma to all beings. ’

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / shing gang dag rlung gis btud /
analyzed: dper na / shing gang dag rlung gis btud /
translated: The trees that bow to the wind,

original: kun tu btud /
analyzed: kun tu btud /
translated: bow completely to the wind,

original: rab tu btud pa de dag 'gyel bar 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: rab tu btud pa de dag 'gyel bar 'jigs pa med do //
translated: do not fear falling down.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' gang dag sems can thams cad la 'dud /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' gang dag sems can thams cad la 'dud /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the bodhisattvas who bow to all beings,

original: kun tu 'dud /
analyzed: kun tu 'dud /
translated: bow completely to all beings,

original: rab tu 'dud pa de dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: rab tu 'dud pa de dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'jigs pa med do //
translated: do not fear falling to the level of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / chu ni gang du dma' ba der 'bab bo //
analyzed: dper na / chu ni gang du dma' ba der 'bab bo //
translated: Water flows down to the low point.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du nga rgyal med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ga la ba der 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du nga rgyal med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ga la ba der 'gro'o //
translated: Likewise, Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva who is free of pride will go wherever omniscience is.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / nam rgya mtsho chen po dang po gnas pa de'i tshe sa chen po thams cad kyi nang na dma' ba'i sa phyogs der dang por gnas te /
analyzed: dper na / nam rgya mtsho chen po dang po gnas pa de'i tshe sa chen po thams cad kyi nang na dma' ba'i sa phyogs der dang por gnas te /
translated: For example, when the great ocean first comes into existence, it first settles in the lowest place on the great earth.

original: de nas 'bab chu'i rgyun thams cad tshegs chung dus der mngon du 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas 'bab chu'i rgyun thams cad tshegs chung dus der mngon du 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, with little difficulty, all the streams flow into it.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du nga rgyal med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la tshegs chung ngus sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thams @400b cad du mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du nga rgyal med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la tshegs chung ngus sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thams @400b cad du mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, Mañjuśrī, for the bodhisattva who is free of pride, all the qualities of the Buddha come into existence with little difficulty.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / nor bu rin po che rdo rjes nor bu rin po che thams cad 'bigs mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na / nor bu rin po che rdo rjes nor bu rin po che thams cad 'bigs mod kyi /
translated: For example, a diamond gem pierces all gems,

original: nor bu rin po che rdo rje de ni de dag gis mi phigs so //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che rdo rje de ni de dag gis mi phigs so //
translated: but that diamond gem is not pierced by them.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams 'dul mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams 'dul mod kyi /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the bodhisattva tames the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: de dag gi 'dul ba der yang mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi 'dul ba der yang mi ltung ngo //
translated: but he does not fall into their taming.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / me tog mand'a ra ba rlung gis bskyod na dpag tshad brgya kho ra khor yug tu dris khyab bo //
analyzed: dper na / me tog mand'a ra ba rlung gis bskyod na dpag tshad brgya kho ra khor yug tu dris khyab bo //
translated: when a mandārava flower is stirred by the wind, its fragrance spreads for a hundred leagues all around.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis bskyod pa'ang sems can thams cad la byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i dris khyab par byed do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis bskyod pa'ang sems can thams cad la byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i dris khyab par byed do //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, when the bodhisattva is stirred by the wisdom of the noble ones, the fragrance of his great love and great compassion spreads to all sentient beings.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / gang dag me tog mand'a ra ba'i dri snom pa de dag ni nad thams cad kyis mi 'debs so //
analyzed: dper na / gang dag me tog mand'a ra ba'i dri snom pa de dag ni nad thams cad kyis mi 'debs so //
translated: those who smell the fragrance of the mandārava flower are not afflicted by any illness.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gang dag byang chub sems dpa'i byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i dri snom pa de dag nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad kyis mi tshugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gang dag byang chub sems dpa'i byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i dri snom pa de dag nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad kyis mi tshugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, those who smell the fragrance of the great love and great compassion of the bodhisattvas will not be harmed by any of the sicknesses of the afflictions.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / sangs rgyas 'byung ba med na au dumb'a ra'i me tog mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na / sangs rgyas 'byung ba med na au dumb'a ra'i me tog mi 'byung ngo //
translated: If a buddha does not appear, the udumbara flower will not appear.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa med na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi me tog kyang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa med na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi me tog kyang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, if the mind of awakening is not generated, the flower of the qualities of a buddha will not appear.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / nam klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa char 'beb pa de'i @401a *//
analyzed: dper na / nam klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa char 'beb pa de'i @401a *//
translated: When the king of the nāgas Anavatapta rains down,

original: tshe / dzambu'i gling thams cad khyab par char 'bebs so //
analyzed: tshe / dzambu'i gling thams cad khyab par char 'bebs so //
translated: it rains everywhere in Jambudvīpa.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du nam byang chub sems dpa' dam pa'i chos kyi char 'bebs pa de'i tshe sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud la mnyam par 'bebs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du nam byang chub sems dpa' dam pa'i chos kyi char 'bebs pa de'i tshe sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud la mnyam par 'bebs so //
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, when the bodhisattva rains down the rain of the sublime Dharma, it rains equally into the mindstreams of all sentient beings.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / mtsho chen po ma dros pa las klung gi rgyun bzhi 'bab ste /
analyzed: dper na / mtsho chen po ma dros pa las klung gi rgyun bzhi 'bab ste /
translated: For example, four great rivers flow from Lake Anavatapta

original: rgya mtsho chen po bzhi yongs su 'gengs so //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po bzhi yongs su 'gengs so //
translated: and fill the four great oceans.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi 'bab pas ye shes kyi rgya mtsho chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi 'bab pas ye shes kyi rgya mtsho chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the great ocean of wisdom is filled by the four rivers of the means of gathering.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / rgya mtsho chen po med na dzambu'i gling gi mi rnams nor bu rin po che la spyod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / rgya mtsho chen po med na dzambu'i gling gi mi rnams nor bu rin po che la spyod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, if the great ocean did not exist, the people of Jambudvīpa would not enjoy the precious jewels.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du sangs rgyas 'byung ba med na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad rnam par grol ba'i chos rin po che la spyod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du sangs rgyas 'byung ba med na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad rnam par grol ba'i chos rin po che la spyod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, if the buddhas did not appear, all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas would not enjoy the precious Dharma of complete liberation.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / gzugs gang ci'ang rung ste /
analyzed: dper na / gzugs gang ci'ang rung ste /
translated: For example, whatever forms there are

original: de dag thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhis yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhis yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: are all supported by the four great elements.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos gang ci'ang rung ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos gang ci'ang rung ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, whatever the Dharma of the bodhisattvas may be,

original: de dag thams cad byin gyis rlabs bzhis yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: de dag thams cad byin gyis rlabs bzhis yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: it is all embraced by four kinds of blessings.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / g-yang sa nyam nga ba na 'dug pa'i sman gyi shing skye bo mang po'i nye bar 'tsho bar mi @401b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / g-yang sa nyam nga ba na 'dug pa'i sman gyi shing skye bo mang po'i nye bar 'tsho bar mi @401b 'gyur ro //
translated: a medicinal tree growing in a dangerous abyss cannot be of service to many beings.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du nyan thos 'khor bas 'jigs pa'i g-yang sa nyam nga bar gnas pa rnams kyi ni skye bo mang pos nye bar 'tsho bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du nyan thos 'khor bas 'jigs pa'i g-yang sa nyam nga bar gnas pa rnams kyi ni skye bo mang pos nye bar 'tsho bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, those who are frightened by saṃsāra and stand in a dangerous abyss cannot be of service to many beings.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / grong khyer gyi nang na 'dug pa'i sman gyi shing ni skye bo mang po'i nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / grong khyer gyi nang na 'dug pa'i sman gyi shing ni skye bo mang po'i nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: a medicinal tree growing in a city can be of service to many beings.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i nang du song ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems bskyed pas sems can thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i nang du song ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems bskyed pas sems can thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the bodhisattva who has entered great love and great compassion becomes the support for all sentient beings through the generation of the mind of omniscience.

original: gzhan du sgro 'dogs par mi bgyid /🔽mnyam pa nyid la mnyam par mi bgyid /
analyzed: gzhan du sgro 'dogs par mi bgyid / mnyam pa nyid la mnyam par mi bgyid /
translated: when one does not reify others,🔽when one does not equalize what is unequal,

original: mi mnyam pa nyid la mi mnyam par mi bgyid cing /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa nyid la mi mnyam par mi bgyid cing /
translated: when one does not make unequal what is equal,

original: bgyid pa ma mchis /
analyzed: bgyid pa ma mchis /
translated: when one does not act,

original: rnam par bgyid pa ma mchis /
analyzed: rnam par bgyid pa ma mchis /
translated: when one does not form,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang yang spyod pa gcig tu gyur pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang yang spyod pa gcig tu gyur pa /
translated: they are in accord with the conduct of the blessed buddhas;

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / chos kyi sku'i rjes su 'jug pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / chos kyi sku'i rjes su 'jug pa /
translated: they follow the buddha body and the dharmakāya;

original: gang gi lus kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi rjes su zhugs par mthong ba /🔽mthong ba la mthong bar mi mthong ba /
analyzed: gang gi lus kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi rjes su zhugs par mthong ba / mthong ba la mthong bar mi mthong ba /
translated: they see the body as following the realm of phenomena;🔽they do not see seeing as seeing;

original: log par mi mthong ba /
analyzed: log par mi mthong ba /
translated: they do not see falsely;

original: gang la'ang ring por mi 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang la'ang ring por mi 'gyur ba /
translated: they do not become distant from anything;

original: nye bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur bgyis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur bgyis par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they do not become close to anything.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: nam tshul bzhin ma lags par ni ma lags kyi /🔽nam tshul bzhin du zhu ba /
analyzed: nam tshul bzhin ma lags par ni ma lags kyi / nam tshul bzhin du zhu ba /
translated: it is not by being improper that they serve the Thus-Gone One,🔽but by being proper.

original: tshul bzhin ma lags pa /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma lags pa /
translated: What is proper and what is improper

original: ci'ang mi mthong ba /
analyzed: ci'ang mi mthong ba /
translated: are not seen at all.

original: bdag gi tshul bzhin gyis chos thams cad kyi tshul bzhin gyi rjes su mchi ba g-yengs pa'i sems kyis ma lags kyi /
analyzed: bdag gi tshul bzhin gyis chos thams cad kyi tshul bzhin gyi rjes su mchi ba g-yengs pa'i sems kyis ma lags kyi /
translated: It is not with a distracted mind that they follow the proper way of all phenomena according to their proper way,

original: mnyam @407b par bzhag pas zhu ba /
analyzed: mnyam @407b par bzhag pas zhu ba /
translated: but by being in equipoise that they ask questions.

original: gang zhu ba dang / gang gi slad du zhu ba dang / gang la zhu ba de dus gsum yongs su 'tshol zhing /
analyzed: gang zhu ba dang / gang gi slad du zhu ba dang / gang la zhu ba de dus gsum yongs su 'tshol zhing /
translated: They should be thoroughly investigating the one who is asking, the reason for asking, and the one to whom they are asking.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas zhu ba de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa la yongs su zhus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas zhu ba de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa la yongs su zhus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Such an inquiry is a thorough inquiry to the Thus-Gone One, since it is thoroughly pure in terms of the three spheres.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: nam zhu ba mchis pa la rtogs par mi bgyid pa /
analyzed: nam zhu ba mchis pa la rtogs par mi bgyid pa /
translated: when one does not conceptualize the question,

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i rjes su mthun par bgyid pa /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i rjes su mthun par bgyid pa /
translated: one follows the teachings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes par bgyid pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes par bgyid pa /
translated: One pleases the Thus-Gone One.

original: 'khor thams cad mgu bar bgyid pa /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad mgu bar bgyid pa /
translated: One pleases the entire retinue.

original: yongs su zhu ba la mi chags pa /
analyzed: yongs su zhu ba la mi chags pa /
translated: One is not attached to the inquiry.

original: yongs su zhu ba des kyang sems can tshad ma mchis pa rnams byang chub tu go cha skon zhing /
analyzed: yongs su zhu ba des kyang sems can tshad ma mchis pa rnams byang chub tu go cha skon zhing /
translated: Through this inquiry, one dons the armor of awakening for countless beings.

original: go cha de'ang nam byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du mi 'dor ba de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa la yongs su legs par zhu ba bgyid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: go cha de'ang nam byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du mi 'dor ba de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa la yongs su legs par zhu ba bgyid par 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not discard this armor until one reaches the seat of awakening. Such is a thorough inquiry to the Thus-Gone One.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od kyi tog des 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od kyi tog des 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: Then the bhagavat, the tathagata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha King of Light Rays said to youthful Manjushri, “Excellent!

original: 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pa la de ltar blta bar bya'o //🔽de ltar phyag bya'o //🔽de ltar bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pa la de ltar blta bar bya'o // de ltar phyag bya'o // de ltar bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: Manjushri, you should view the tathagata in that way.🔽You should pay homage in that way.

original: de ltar yongs su zhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su zhu bar bya'o //
translated: You should serve in that way.🔽You should ask in that way.

original: de ltar yongs su legs par zhu ba bya'o zhes smras pa de ni khyod kyis legs par bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su legs par zhu ba bya'o zhes smras pa de ni khyod kyis legs par bshad de /
translated: You should ask well in that way.”

original: legs so // legs so //🔽de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas nyan thos chen po shes rab sgron ma la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽tshe dang @408a *//
analyzed: legs so // legs so // de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas nyan thos chen po shes rab sgron ma la 'di skad ces smras so // tshe dang @408a *//
translated: He said, “Excellent! Excellent!

original: ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa la ji ltar mthong /🔽ji ltar phyag 'tshal /
analyzed: ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa la ji ltar mthong / ji ltar phyag 'tshal /
translated: Then youthful Manjushri said to the great shravaka Wisdom Lamp, “Venerable one, how do you view the tathagata?🔽How do you pay homage?

original: ji ltar bsnyen bkur byed /
analyzed: ji ltar bsnyen bkur byed /
translated: How do you serve?

original: ji ltar yongs su zhu /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su zhu /
translated: How do you ask?

original: ji ltar yongs su legs par zhu /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su legs par zhu /
translated: How do you ask well?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He replied,🔽“Manjushri, I view the tathagata as the tathagata.

original: 'jam dpal / bstan pa 'di lta bu ni kho bo cag lta bu nyan thos gzhan gyi sgra'i rjes su mos pa rnams kyi yul ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / bstan pa 'di lta bu ni kho bo cag lta bu nyan thos gzhan gyi sgra'i rjes su mos pa rnams kyi yul ma yin no //
translated: Mañjuśrī, this teaching is not the domain of those like me, who are śrāvakas who believe in the words of others.

original: smras pa / 'o na gang /
analyzed: smras pa / 'o na gang /
translated: ” He replied, “Well then, what is it?

original: mngon par rtogs pas tshe dang ldan pa shes rab sgron ma'i sems rnam par grol /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pas tshe dang ldan pa shes rab sgron ma'i sems rnam par grol /
translated: ” The venerable one said, “The mind of one who has realized the truth is liberated.

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: ” He replied, “Mañjuśrī,

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pas sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pas sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: the mind is liberated by realizing the truth.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: ” He said, “Venerable one,

original: bden pa zhes bya bas ci bstan par 'gyur /
analyzed: bden pa zhes bya bas ci bstan par 'gyur /
translated: what is taught by the word ‘truth’?

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: ” He replied,

original: 'jam dpal / gnyen po med pas rab tu phye ba ni bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gnyen po med pas rab tu phye ba ni bden pa'o //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, the truth is distinguished by the absence of antidotes.

original: smras pa / 'o na ji ltar bden pa mngon par rtogs pas tshe dang ldan pa'i sems rnam par grol /
analyzed: smras pa / 'o na ji ltar bden pa mngon par rtogs pas tshe dang ldan pa'i sems rnam par grol /
translated: ” He said, “Well then, how is the mind of the venerable one liberated by realizing the truth?

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /🔽kun rdzob nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal / kun rdzob nye bar bzung ste /
translated: ” He replied, “Mañjuśrī,🔽it is taught in terms of the conventional,

original: de skad ces ston gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de skad ces ston gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in terms of the ultimate.

original: smras pa / ci kun rdzob don dam par 'du'am /
analyzed: smras pa / ci kun rdzob don dam par 'du'am /
translated: ” He said, “Does the conventional exist ultimately?

original: smras pa / gal te mi 'dun don dam pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / gal te mi 'dun don dam pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, “If you do not have the will, you will not have the ultimate.”

original: smras pa / 'o na ji ltar kun rdzob nye bar bzung ste ston gyi /
analyzed: smras pa / 'o na ji ltar kun rdzob nye bar bzung ste ston gyi /
translated: “Well then, how do you teach, taking the conventional as your point of reference?

original: don dam par ni ma yin /🔽gal te kun rdzob don dam par 'du na ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin / gal te kun rdzob don dam par 'du na ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Is it not the case that you do not teach the ultimate?

original: don dam pa'i bden pa bden pa gcig pur mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa bden pa gcig pur mi 'gyur ram /
translated: If the conventional were the ultimate, then there would be only one truth, the ultimate truth.

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: ” Vimalakīrti replied, “Mañjuśrī,

original: bshad pa 'di thos na las dang po pa'i byang @408b chub sems dpa' rnams skrag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di thos na las dang po pa'i byang @408b chub sems dpa' rnams skrag par 'gyur ro //
translated: when beginners in the bodhisattva way hear this teaching, they will be frightened.

original: smras pa / btsun pa nyid kyang skrag na las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams lta ci smos /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa nyid kyang skrag na las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams lta ci smos /
translated: ” Mañjuśrī said, “Venerable One, if you are frightened, what need is there to speak of the beginners in the bodhisattva way?

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: ” Vimalakīrti replied, “Mañjuśrī,

original: kho po skrag par byed mi nus so //
analyzed: kho po skrag par byed mi nus so //
translated: I am not frightened.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: ” Mañjuśrī said, “Venerable One,

original: ci skrag pa med pa dang / skyo ba med pas nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lam /
analyzed: ci skrag pa med pa dang / skyo ba med pas nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lam /
translated: is it not the case that the mind is liberated from the afflictions without appropriation, without fear and without sorrow?

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: ” Vimalakīrti replied, “Mañjuśrī,

original: nyan thos rnams ni skrag pa med pa dang / skyo ba med par rnam par mi grol lo //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni skrag pa med pa dang / skyo ba med par rnam par mi grol lo //
translated: The śrāvakas are not liberated without fear and without weariness.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: He replied, “Venerable One,

original: de bas na sngon skrag pa de nyid la bsams nas btsun pa nyid kyang skrag na las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams lta ci smos zhes de skad smras so //
analyzed: de bas na sngon skrag pa de nyid la bsams nas btsun pa nyid kyang skrag na las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams lta ci smos zhes de skad smras so //
translated: therefore, thinking of that previous fear, I said, ‘Even you, Venerable One, are afraid, let alone the beginner bodhisattvas.’ ”

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: He replied, “Mañjuśrī,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar rnam par grol /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar rnam par grol /
translated: how are the bodhisattvas liberated?”🔽He replied, “Venerable One,

original: smras pa / btsun pa; byang chub sems dpa' ni skrag pa med pa dang / skyo ba med pas rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa; byang chub sems dpa' ni skrag pa med pa dang / skyo ba med pas rnam par grol lo //
translated: the bodhisattvas are liberated without fear and without weariness.”

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: He replied, “Mañjuśrī,

original: ji la bsams te de skad smra /
analyzed: ji la bsams te de skad smra /
translated: what were you thinking when you said that?”

original: smras pa / bdud kyi sde bye ba phrag brgyas mi skrag cing sems can rnams la chos bshad pas mi skyo la /
analyzed: smras pa / bdud kyi sde bye ba phrag brgyas mi skrag cing sems can rnams la chos bshad pas mi skyo la /
translated: He replied, “They are not afraid of the hundreds of thousands of māras, and they are not weary of explaining the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs tshad med pa bsags pas mi skrag cing ye shes kyi tshogs tshad med pa bsags pas mi skye'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs tshad med pa bsags pas mi skrag cing ye shes kyi tshogs tshad med pa bsags pas mi skye'o //
translated: They are not afraid of accumulating immeasurable collections of merit, and they are not weary of accumulating immeasurable collections of wisdom.”

original: de nas 'khor der lha'i bu gang dag 'dus par gyur pa de dag gis me tog sna tshogs kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la gtor to //
analyzed: de nas 'khor der lha'i bu gang dag 'dus par gyur pa de dag gis me tog sna tshogs kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la gtor to //
translated: Then, the sons of the gods who had gathered in that retinue scattered various flowers upon Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta.

original: gang na 'jam dpal gzhon nur @409a *//
analyzed: gang na 'jam dpal gzhon nur @409a *//
translated: Wherever Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta appears,

original: gyur pa snang ba der ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gyur pa snang ba der ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du mthong ba yin no //
translated: there the Tathāgata is seen in person.

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa gang du gnas pa'i sa phyogs de'ang mchod rten du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa gang du gnas pa'i sa phyogs de'ang mchod rten du 'gyur ro //
translated: The place where Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta dwells becomes a stūpa.

original: gang gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i chos bstan pa kun du shes sam /
analyzed: gang gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i chos bstan pa kun du shes sam /
translated: Those beings who understand or will understand the Dharma teachings of Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta

original: kun du shes par 'gyur ba'i sems can de dag gis kyang bsod nams thams cad yongs su bzung ba yin no zhes de skad kyi tshig smras so //
analyzed: kun du shes par 'gyur ba'i sems can de dag gis kyang bsod nams thams cad yongs su bzung ba yin no zhes de skad kyi tshig smras so //
translated: have also taken up all merit.”

original: de nas yang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas nyan thos chen po shes rab sgron ma la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas yang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas nyan thos chen po shes rab sgron ma la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then again, Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said to the great hearer Prajñāpradīpa:

original: tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: “Venerable one,

original: nyan thos rnams kyi nang na shes rab che ba'i mchog tu bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs na /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi nang na shes rab che ba'i mchog tu bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs na /
translated: “The Blessed One has said that you have the greatest wisdom of all the hearers.

original: ci shes rab de 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: ci shes rab de 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: Is that wisdom a conditioned characteristic?

original: 'on te 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid /
analyzed: 'on te 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid /
translated: Or is it an unconditioned characteristic?

original: gal te de 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin na ni skye zhing 'jig pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin na ni skye zhing 'jig pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is a conditioned characteristic, then it must have arising and cessation.

original: ji ste 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni mtshan nyid gsum las ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni mtshan nyid gsum las ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is an unconditioned characteristic, then it must be the opposite of the three characteristics.

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: ” “Mañjuśrī,

original: 'phags pa rnams ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye bar ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye bar ston to //
translated: the noble ones are taught to be distinguished by the unconditioned.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: ” “Venerable one,

original: 'dus ma byas pa gdags par nus sam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa gdags par nus sam /
translated: can the unconditioned be designated?

original: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jam dpal /
translated: ” “Mañjuśrī,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: no, it cannot.

original: 'dus ma byas la gdags pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la gdags pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is no designation whatsoever in the unconditioned.

original: smras pa / 'o na ji ltar 'phags pa rnams 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye @409b ba ston /
analyzed: smras pa / 'o na ji ltar 'phags pa rnams 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye @409b ba ston /
translated: ” “Well then, how is it that the noble ones are taught to be distinguished by the unconditioned?

original: de skad smras pa dang / nyan thos chen po shes rab sgron ma de cang mi smra bar gyur to //
analyzed: de skad smras pa dang / nyan thos chen po shes rab sgron ma de cang mi smra bar gyur to //
translated: When he had said this, the great śrāvaka Prajñākūṭa remained silent.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od kyi tog des 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od kyi tog des 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Arciṣmant said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta,

original: 'jam dpal / chos gang thos pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi sgo 'ga' zhig rtsoms te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / chos gang thos pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi sgo 'ga' zhig rtsoms te /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, please teach some Dharma doors, so that when bodhisattva great beings hear them, they will not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'khor 'dir khyod kyis ston cig /
analyzed: 'khor 'dir khyod kyis ston cig /
translated: Please teach them to this assembly.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad kyi sgo rnams kyi bstan pa thams cad kyang dben pa'i sgo ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sgo rnams kyi bstan pa thams cad kyang dben pa'i sgo ste /
translated: all the teachings on the doors of all phenomena are doors of solitude.

original: dben pa'i sgo de dag dben pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: dben pa'i sgo de dag dben pa nyid du ston to //
translated: Those doors of solitude teach that solitude is itself solitude.”

original: yang de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi blo gros zhes bya ba 'khor der 'dus par gyur te 'dug pa des 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽'jam dpal / gang de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug bstan pa de dag ci dben pa'i sgo ste /
analyzed: yang de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi blo gros zhes bya ba 'khor der 'dus par gyur te 'dug pa des 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so // 'jam dpal / gang de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug bstan pa de dag ci dben pa'i sgo ste /
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva Dharmamati, who was present in the assembly, said this to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:🔽“Mañjuśrī, are the things taught by the Tathāgata—desire, anger, and delusion—doors to solitude?🔽

analyzed: mthong ngo // bde bar gshegs pa /

analyzed: mthong ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis kho bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Bhagavān said to me,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: ‘Ānanda,

analyzed: phyi ma'i dus phyi ma'i tshe lnga brgya tha ma la dam pa'i chos 'jig pa'i tshe nga'i bstan pa la dge slong dag phal cher 'di bzhin du sham thabs legs par ma gyon pa /

original: gos brtul te gyon pa /
analyzed: gos brtul te gyon pa /

analyzed: lhung bzad chag pa /

analyzed: shes bzhin med pa /

analyzed: mtshams las 'da' ba dang / tshe 'di ched che bar byed pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan ched mi che bar byed par 'gyur te /

original: de dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag 'di lta ste /

analyzed: kun dga' bo /

analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na nga'i bstan pa 'di la ltar mi rung ba dang / mnyan du mi rung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: lha rnams kyang yid mi dga' bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bdud rnams yi rangs shing dga' ba dang / btang snyoms su 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la kho bos 'di skad ces gsol to //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: ci'i slad du na bdud sdig can rnams yi rangs shing dga' ba dang / btang snyoms su 'gyur /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: kun dga' @424a *//
analyzed: kun dga' @424a *//

analyzed: bo; 'di ltar skyes bu blun po de dag bdag nyid bdud kyi las byed par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de la bar chad bya ba'i phyir phyir zhing bdud sdig can brtson par mi 'gyur ro //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: bdud sdig can ni mi brtson pa rnams la glags mi tshol gyi /
translated: The māras do not seek to create obstacles for those who are not making an effort.

original: kun dga' bo /🔽de lta bas na ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang; mngon du ma byas pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir sbyor bar byos shig /
analyzed: kun dga' bo / de lta bas na ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang; mngon du ma byas pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir sbyor bar byos shig /
translated: Ānanda,

original: brtsal bar byos shig /
analyzed: brtsal bar byos shig /
translated: therefore, apply yourselves to the attainment of what has not been attained, to the realization of what has not been realized, and to the manifestation of what has not been manifested.🔽Strive,

original: 'bad par byos shig /
analyzed: 'bad par byos shig /
translated: exert yourselves,

original: bdud kyi phyogs tshar chod cig /
analyzed: bdud kyi phyogs tshar chod cig /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'bar bar byos shig /

original: nga la chos kyi mchod pas mchod cig /
analyzed: nga la chos kyi mchod pas mchod cig /

original: 'di ni khyod la rjes su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni khyod la rjes su bstan pa yin no //

original: bstan pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe dge slong lnga stong gis tshe'i 'du byed spangs par gyur te /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe dge slong lnga stong gis tshe'i 'du byed spangs par gyur te /
translated: When this teaching was explained, five thousand monks gave up their vital force.

analyzed: bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi dam pa'i chos rnam par 'jig pa mthong bar ma gyur cig ces de skad kyi tshig smras nas /

analyzed: de dag steng gi bar snang la mngon par 'phags te /

analyzed: rang gi me'i khams kyis bdag nyid bsregs so //

analyzed: lha'i bu 'bum gyis kyang de dag la mchod pa byas @424b bar gyur to //

analyzed: dge slong nyis brgya ni chos la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /

analyzed: dge slong nyis brgya ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: Two hundred monks attained liberation of mind from the defilements without further grasping.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sum khri nyis stong ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: Thirty-two thousand bodhisattvas attained acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena.

analyzed: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dag kyang 'khor dang bcas te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga na thal mo sbyar te /
translated: Śakra, Brahmā, and the world guardians, together with their retinues, stood before the Blessed One with palms joined.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: bdag cag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi dam pa'i chos rnam par 'jig pa mi mthong bar bgyi ba dang / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,🔽we will do so that those in whose ears this Dharma discourse resounds will never be tainted by the stain of laziness of mind, and that they will not come under the power of any arising or arisen works of Māra.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di gang dag gi rna lam du grags par gyur pa de dag nam yang sems le lo'i dri mas kun nas mi gnas par bgyi ba dang / de dag bdud kyi las byung zhing byung ba rnams kyi dbang du mi 'gyur bar bcom ldan 'das sku tshe ring du bzhugs shing bskyang bar gsol zhes smras so //

translated: Lord, we request that you live on for a long time, caring for us.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pa dang / chos ston pa rnam par 'phrul pa las gang kho bos phyogs tsam zhig mngon sum du gyur pa ni de lta bu de dag yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pa dang / chos ston pa rnam par 'phrul pa las gang kho bos phyogs tsam zhig mngon sum du gyur pa ni de lta bu de dag yin no //
translated: this is the extent of what I have directly perceived of the magical emanations of Mañjuśrī, the Youth, in his magical emanations of teaching the Dharma.”

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the Venerable Mahākāśyapa said to the Venerable Śāriputra:

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / kho bos kyang 'jam @425a *//
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,🔽I too have directly perceived some of the magical displays of Mañjuśrī,

analyzed: dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul kha cig mngon sum du gyur to //
translated: the Youth.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: kho bos mngon par shes te /
analyzed: kho bos mngon par shes te /
translated: I have understood this:

original: bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon pa /🔽kho bo'ang rab tu byung nas ring po ma lon pa zhig na 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen srog shing gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon pa / kho bo'ang rab tu byung nas ring po ma lon pa zhig na 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen srog shing gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang /
translated: Not long after the Blessed One’s complete awakening,

original: bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir dang po 'ongs par gyur te /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir dang po 'ongs par gyur te /
translated: not long after I went forth, Mañjuśrī, the Youth, first came to this world from the buddha realm of the blessed thus-gone Jewel Tree in order to see, pay homage to, and serve the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung na mnyan yod kyi rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba 'dir dbyar gnas par dam bca' mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung na mnyan yod kyi rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba 'dir dbyar gnas par dam bca' mdzad do //
translated: He made a vow to spend the rainy season in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada, in Śrāvastī, in the presence of the Bhagavat.

analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'ang der dbyar zla ba gsum gnas par dam bcas nas /
translated: Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta also made a vow to spend the three months of the rainy season there.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga dang / dge 'dun gyi nang dang / bkad sa dang / gso sbyong dang / phyag 'tshal b'i las la kho bo cag gi phyir nam yang ma mthong bar gyur to //
translated: But I never saw him in the presence of the Bhagavat, in the midst of the saṅgha, in the assembly hall, during the confession ceremony, or when prostrating.

original: de nas dbyar zla ba gsum zad de 'das pa dang / gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye'i tshe 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: de nas dbyar zla ba gsum zad de 'das pa dang / gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye'i tshe 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bzhin bstan to //
translated: Then, when the three months of the rainy season had passed, during the confession ceremony and the lifting of restrictions, Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta revealed his face.

original: de la kho bos 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de la kho bos 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: I said to him,

original: 'jam dpal khyod dbyar gyi zla ba de gsum gyi tshe gang na 'dug 'dug /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod dbyar gyi zla ba de gsum gyi tshe gang na 'dug 'dug /
translated: ‘Mañjuśrī, where did you stay during those three months of the rainy season?’

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,🔽‘Bhikṣus, I stayed in the great Avīci hell.’

original: btsun pa 'od srung @425b chen po mnyan yod kyi grong khyer chen po 'di nyid na rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi btsun mo'i nang na'o //
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srung @425b chen po mnyan yod kyi grong khyer chen po 'di nyid na rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi btsun mo'i nang na'o //
translated: “Venerable Mahākāśyapa is in the inner palace of King Prasenajit in this great city of Śrāvastī.”

original: de la kho bo 'di snyam du gyur te /
analyzed: de la kho bo 'di snyam du gyur te /
translated: I thought,

original: sems dpa' 'di lta bu ltung ba dang bcas pa dang yongs su dag pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun dang lhan cig dgag dbye byar mi rung ngo snyam du gyur nas /
analyzed: sems dpa' 'di lta bu ltung ba dang bcas pa dang yongs su dag pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun dang lhan cig dgag dbye byar mi rung ngo snyam du gyur nas /
translated: ‘It is not right for this great being to perform the poṣadha ceremony together with the community of monks, some of whom have faults and some of whom are pure.’

original: kho bo 'khor gyi khyams de nas byung ste /
analyzed: kho bo 'khor gyi khyams de nas byung ste /
translated: I left the courtyard

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa bskrad pa'i phyir gandi brdungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa bskrad pa'i phyir gandi brdungs so //
translated: and beat the gong to expel the youthful Mañjuśrī.

original: der bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: der bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the youthful Mañjuśrī,

original: 'jam dpal / gnas brtan 'od srung chen po ci'i phyir gandi brdungs pa soms shig /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gnas brtan 'od srung chen po ci'i phyir gandi brdungs pa soms shig /
translated: ‘Mañjuśrī, think about why the elder Mahākāśyapa beat the gong.’

original: des gsol pa /
analyzed: des gsol pa /
translated: He replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ‘Blessed One,

original: bsams na bdag bskrad pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: bsams na bdag bskrad pa'i slad du'o //
translated: if I think about it, it is because I was expelled.’

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽‘Mañjuśrī,

original: 'jam dpal khyod la ma dad pa chen po byed par mi 'gyur par bdag nyid tshangs par byos shig /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod la ma dad pa chen po byed par mi 'gyur par bdag nyid tshangs par byos shig /
translated: Mañjuśrī, you should purify yourself so that you do not incur great disbelief.

original: rang gi spyod yul ston cig /
analyzed: rang gi spyod yul ston cig /
translated: Show us your own domain.

original: nyan thos chen po rnams mgu bar byos shig /
analyzed: nyan thos chen po rnams mgu bar byos shig /
translated: Please the great hearers.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: Then the youthful Mañjuśrī at that time entered the bodhisattva absorption called “revealing all buddha realms.”

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas kyi zhing sgang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed na sbyangs pa'i yon tan smra ba'i dge slong @426a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe phyogs bcu na sangs rgyas kyi zhing sgang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed na sbyangs pa'i yon tan smra ba'i dge slong @426a *//
translated: As soon as the youthful Mañjuśrī entered that absorption, at that time in the ten directions in buddha realms as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, bhikṣus who were like the great bhikṣu Kāśyapa, who were expounders of the qualities of purification,

original: 'od srung chen po 'dra ba sha stag 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa bskrad pa'i phyir gandi brdung bar snang bar gyur to //
