translated: Having abandoned the discrimination of self, they cross over the four rivers.

original: de dag brgal pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: de dag brgal pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: Having crossed over, they are counted among those who have reached the other shore and attained parinirvāṇa.

original: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
translated: “Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: de la bdag gam /
analyzed: de la bdag gam /
translated: Is there a self,

original: sems can nam /🔽srog gam / skye ba po'am /
analyzed: sems can nam / srog gam / skye ba po'am /
translated: a sentient being,

original: gang zag gang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa yod dam /
analyzed: gang zag gang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa yod dam /
translated: a life-force, a person, or an individual who attains parinirvāṇa?

original: kho bos de la smras pa /
analyzed: kho bos de la smras pa /
translated: ” I replied,

original: 'jam dpal / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de ni ma yin te /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, that is not so.

original: 'on kyang mnyam pa nyid yang dag par bstan pas phyin ci log spong ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang mnyam pa nyid yang dag par bstan pas phyin ci log spong ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, by teaching true sameness, one abandons error.

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: ” Mañjuśrī said,

original: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
translated: “Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: 'di lta bu'i phyir sangs rgyas 'byung @429a *//
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i phyir sangs rgyas 'byung @429a *//
translated: the Buddha appears for such a reason.

original: ste / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: mnyam pa nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to teach the sameness of all things.

original: skye ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: It is not for the sake of origination,

original: 'gag pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: not for the sake of cessation,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa 'ba' zhig rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa 'ba' zhig rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but for the sake of realizing the sole principle of the absence of afflictions.

original: kho bos de la 'di skad smras so //
analyzed: kho bos de la 'di skad smras so //
translated: I said to him,

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gang dag rang bzhin de lta bu'i chos kyi dbyings la'ang rtog cing /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gang dag rang bzhin de lta bu'i chos kyi dbyings la'ang rtog cing /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, those bodhisattvas who understand the realm of phenomena to be of such a nature

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i go cha'ang mi 'dor la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i go cha'ang mi 'dor la /
translated: and who do not cast off the armor for the sake of ripening all sentient beings,

original: zhum par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: zhum par mi 'gyur /
translated: who are neither discouraged

original: rangs par mi 'gyur zhing rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya nga las 'das pa'i sems can rnams kyi phyir go cha bgos pa ni dka' ba byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rangs par mi 'gyur zhing rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya nga las 'das pa'i sems can rnams kyi phyir go cha bgos pa ni dka' ba byed pa ma yin no //
translated: nor elated, and who don the armor for the sake of sentient beings who are naturally in a state of parinirvāṇa, are not performing a difficult feat.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: ” He said,

original: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
translated: “Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni go cha chen po bgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni go cha chen po bgos pa yin no //
translated: in that way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva dons the great armor.🔽” I said to him,

original: de la kho bos 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de la kho bos 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: “Mañjuśrī,

original: 'jam dpal khyod byang chub sems dpa'i go cha brtsam par spobs par gyis shig /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod byang chub sems dpa'i go cha brtsam par spobs par gyis shig /
translated: Mañjuśrī, you should be confident in explaining the armor of the bodhisattvas.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
translated: “Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i go cha chen po ni sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i go cha chen po ni sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: the great armor of the bodhisattvas is thirty-two.🔽The bodhisattvas who don the armor of those thirty-two

original: go cha de dag bgos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: go cha de dag bgos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do //
translated: practice the bodhisattva way.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the thirty-two?

original: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /🔽rmi lam gyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyis 'khor ba tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa ni byang chub @429b sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srung chen po / rmi lam gyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyis 'khor ba tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa ni byang chub @429b sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: Venerable Mahākāśyapa,🔽the bodhisattvas’ armor is to embrace the immeasurable saṃsāra with the characteristics of the nature of dreams.

original: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sems can tshad med pa yongs su smin par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sems can tshad med pa yongs su smin par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ armor is to ripen immeasurable sentient beings with the characteristic of selflessness.

original: chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid kyis sangs rgyas tshad med pa la mchod pa dang rim gro byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid kyis sangs rgyas tshad med pa la mchod pa dang rim gro byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the worship and service of immeasurable buddhas through the characteristic of the body of truth.

original: brag ca dang mnyam pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa thams cad nyan cing 'dzin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: brag ca dang mnyam pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa thams cad nyan cing 'dzin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the hearing and retention of all the teachings of the buddhas through the characteristic of their equivalence to an echo.

original: chos kyi dbyings su yang dag par 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad srung ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su yang dag par 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad srung ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the protection of all the teachings of the buddhas through the characteristic of their inclusion in the realm of truth.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdud thams cad 'dul ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdud thams cad 'dul ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the conversion of all demons through the characteristic of the natural purity of all addictive and objective obscurations.

original: yod pa dang med pa sel ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyis phas kyi rgol ba thams cad chos dang mthun pas shin tu tshar gcod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa sel ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyis phas kyi rgol ba thams cad chos dang mthun pas shin tu tshar gcod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the complete destruction of all adversaries through the Dharma, by means of the characteristic of engagement in dependent origination, which eliminates existence and non-existence.

original: phung po thams cad spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyis bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: phung po thams cad spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyis bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the complete giving of all possessions, by means of the characteristic of the abandonment of all the aggregates.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyis yo byad bsnyungs pa thams cad yang dag par len pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //🔽khong khro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bzod pa dang / dul ba dang / des pa @430a *//
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyis yo byad bsnyungs pa thams cad yang dag par len pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o // khong khro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bzod pa dang / dul ba dang / des pa @430a *//
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the taking up of all the austerities of morality, training, and the virtues of purification, by means of the characteristic of the absence of conditioning.

original: ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is patience, gentleness, and self-control, by means of the characteristic of the absence of anger.

original: lus dang sems dben pa'i mtshan nyid kyis blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa'i brtson 'grus ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems dben pa'i mtshan nyid kyis blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa'i brtson 'grus ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the effort of not taking up and not laying down, because of the characteristic of the isolation of body and mind.

original: rten thams cad dben pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: rten thams cad dben pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is all the concentrations, liberations, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions, because of the characteristic of the isolation of all bases.

original: ma rig pa'i gti mug gi lta ba yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis thogs pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i gti mug gi lta ba yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis thogs pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the perfection of wisdom that is unobstructed, because of the characteristic of the purification of the view of ignorance and stupidity.

original: bya ba thams cad ston pa'i mtshan nyid kyis thabs chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad ston pa'i mtshan nyid kyis thabs chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the great means, because of the characteristic of the manifestation of all activities.

original: zhe 'gras pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis byams pa chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: zhe 'gras pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis byams pa chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the great love, because of the characteristic of being without hostility.

original: sor mo lnga dang nam mkha' mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid kyis snying po chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //🔽yongs su mi skyo ba'i mtshan nyid kyis dga' ba chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: sor mo lnga dang nam mkha' mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid kyis snying po chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o // yongs su mi skyo ba'i mtshan nyid kyis dga' ba chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The great essence, equal to space, is the armor of the bodhisattva, by the characteristic of the five fingers.🔽The great joy, by the characteristic of not being wearied, is the armor of the bodhisattva.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis btang snyoms chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis btang snyoms chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The great equanimity, by the characteristic of not being affected by pleasure or pain, is the armor of the bodhisattva.

original: rnam par grol ba lag mthil du 'ongs kyang thob par mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba lag mthil du 'ongs kyang thob par mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The fulfillment of all wishes, by the characteristic of not taking up even the palm of the hand of liberation, is the armor of the bodhisattva.

original: skyon med par mi ltung @430b ba'i mtshan nyid kyis thams cad yid la mi byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: skyon med par mi ltung @430b ba'i mtshan nyid kyis thams cad yid la mi byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The non-attention to everything, by the characteristic of not falling into the absence of error, is the armor of the bodhisattva.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i chos legs par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis phung po lnga gshed ma lta bur gyur pa yongs su srung ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i chos legs par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis phung po lnga gshed ma lta bur gyur pa yongs su srung ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the protection of the five aggregates, which are like murderers, through the knowledge of the illusory nature of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid kyis khams bzhi la sbrul gdug pa lta bur 'dzin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid kyis khams bzhi la sbrul gdug pa lta bur 'dzin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the holding of the four elements to be like poisonous snakes through the sameness of the realm of phenomena.

original: yul thams cad la mi chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis skye mched drug la grong stong pa lta bur rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: yul thams cad la mi chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis skye mched drug la grong stong pa lta bur rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the conception of the six sense bases as an empty town through the characteristic of nonattachment to any object.

original: kun gzhi med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis khams gsum dang mi 'dre pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis khams gsum dang mi 'dre pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the nonmixing of the three realms through the characteristic of the absence of a foundation consciousness.

original: srid pa sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyis ched du srid pa len pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: srid pa sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyis ched du srid pa len pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the deliberate taking up of existence through the characteristic of the elimination of existence.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis dpa' ba chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis dpa' ba chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the great heroism through the characteristic of irreversibility.

original: sems can thams cad la so so ji ltar 'os par chos kyi sman sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sman pa chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la so so ji ltar 'os par chos kyi sman sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sman pa chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The great physician, by the characteristic of giving the medicine of the Dharma to all sentient beings according to their needs, is the armor of the bodhisattva.

original: theg pa gsum gyi lam ston pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ded dpon chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi lam ston pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ded dpon chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The great caravan leader, by the characteristic of showing the path of the three vehicles, is the armor of the bodhisattva.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la byas pa shes shing byas pa gzo ba'i mtshan nyid kyis dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung mi gcod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //🔽mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin gyi skye ba @431a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la byas pa shes shing byas pa gzo ba'i mtshan nyid kyis dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung mi gcod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o // mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin gyi skye ba @431a *//
translated: Not cutting off the lineage of the Three Jewels, by the characteristic of being grateful and thankful to all the Buddhas, is the armor of the bodhisattva.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The characteristic of the non-arising of all phenomena, by the characteristic of attaining patience with respect to unborn phenomena, is the armor of the bodhisattva.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa las 'da' ba'i mtshan nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa las 'da' ba'i mtshan nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: Attaining the irreversible stage, by the characteristic of transcending the stages of all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, is the armor of the bodhisattva.

original: sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis byang chub kyi snying po brgyan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis byang chub kyi snying po brgyan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o //
translated: The armor of the bodhisattva is the adornment of the essence of enlightenment, which is characterized by the realization of all the qualities of the Buddha through the wisdom that comes in a single instant of mind.

original: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
translated: “ Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i go cha chen po sum cu rtsa gnyis ni de dag yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i go cha chen po sum cu rtsa gnyis ni de dag yin te /
translated: these are the thirty-two aspects of the great armor of the bodhisattvas.

original: go cha de dag bgos na 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni gzhan du 'gyur yang srid kyi /
analyzed: go cha de dag bgos na 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni gzhan du 'gyur yang srid kyi /
translated: When they don this armor, it is possible that the four great elements will change,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog pa'i 'jigs pa ni med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog pa'i 'jigs pa ni med do //
translated: but it is impossible for a bodhisattva to turn back from unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de la kho bos 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de la kho bos 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: I then said to him,

original: 'jam dpal / go cha de dag las 'ga' yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la med do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / go cha de dag las 'ga' yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la med do //
translated: ‘Mañjuśrī, none of these aspects of armor are found in the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.’

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He replied,

original: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
translated: ‘Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: de bas na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni go cha chen po ma bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni go cha chen po ma bgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Śrāvakas and Pratyekabuddhas are called ‘not wearing the great armor.’

original: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
translated: “Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: go cha gang mthu dang ldan pa'i 'phong gi slob dpon gyis bgo bar bya ba'i go cha de mi phal gyis bgo bar bya'am /🔽kho bos de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: go cha gang mthu dang ldan pa'i 'phong gi slob dpon gyis bgo bar bya ba'i go cha de mi phal gyis bgo bar bya'am / kho bos de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Is the armor that a master armorer would have his strong son put on the same armor that an ordinary person could put on?”

original: 'jam dpal / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de ni ma yin te /
translated: I said to him, ‘No, Mañjuśrī.

original: mi phal @431b gyis go cha de bgo bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mi phal @431b gyis go cha de bgo bar mi nus so //
translated: An ordinary person cannot put on that armor.’

original: smras pa / btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa 'od srung chen po /
translated: “Mañjuśrī replied, ‘Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: de bzhin du go cha gang byang chub sems dpas bgo bar bya ba de dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad mi gyon no //
analyzed: de bzhin du go cha gang byang chub sems dpas bgo bar bya ba de dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad mi gyon no //
translated: in the same way, the armor that a bodhisattva puts on is not worn by any Śrāvakas or Pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i go cha 'di bshad pa'i tshe lha'i bu khri nyis stong bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i go cha 'di bshad pa'i tshe lha'i bu khri nyis stong bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: When this armor of the bodhisattvas was being taught, twelve thousand gods gave rise to the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos ston pa rnam par 'phrul pa gang kho bos phyogs tsam zhig mngon sum du gyur pa ni de lta bu de dag yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos ston pa rnam par 'phrul pa gang kho bos phyogs tsam zhig mngon sum du gyur pa ni de lta bu de dag yin no //
translated: the youthful Mañjuśrī’s magical displays and his magical displays of teaching the Dharma that I have witnessed are like this.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyani­putra said to Venerable Śāriputra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: kho bos 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul kha cig mngon sum du gyur to //
analyzed: kho bos 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul kha cig mngon sum du gyur to //
translated: I have witnessed some of the youthful Mañjuśrī’s magical displays.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: kho bos mngon par shes pa dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can gyi grong khyer gyi tshal chen po'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i khang pa na /
analyzed: kho bos mngon par shes pa dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can gyi grong khyer gyi tshal chen po'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i khang pa na /
translated: I have had the following experience. Once the Blessed One was in the great hall of the kūṭāgāra in the great forest of Vaiśālī.

original: dge slong lnga brgya tsam gyi dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: dge slong lnga brgya tsam gyi dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs so //
translated: together with a great saṅgha of five hundred monks.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ra dva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ra dva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de'i tshe gcer bu ma'i bu bden pa po zhes bya ba gcer bu pa drug khris yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas te /🔽bsti stang byas /
analyzed: de'i tshe gcer bu ma'i bu bden pa po zhes bya ba gcer bu pa drug khris yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas te / bsti stang byas /
translated: at that time there was a naked ascetic named Satya, a son of the naked ascetics, surrounded by sixty thousand naked ascetics,🔽honored,🔽respected,

original: bla mar byas /🔽ri mo byas /
analyzed: bla mar byas / ri mo byas /
translated: revered,

original: mchod pa byas shing yangs pa can gyi grong khyer na 'dug go /
analyzed: mchod pa byas shing yangs pa can gyi grong khyer na 'dug go /
translated: and worshipped, who was staying in the city of Vaiśālī.

original: @432a *// kho bo ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhu /
analyzed: @432a *// kho bo ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhu /
translated: I entered into meditative absorption,

original: sa te / gzhan mu stegs can de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la bltas nas /
analyzed: sa te / gzhan mu stegs can de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la bltas nas /
translated: and seeing the roots of virtue of those tīrthikas,

original: der kho bos sems can mu stegs can gdul bar bya ba brgya phrag mang po mthong nas /
analyzed: der kho bos sems can mu stegs can gdul bar bya ba brgya phrag mang po mthong nas /
translated: I saw many hundreds of beings to be tamed who were tīrthikas.

original: kho bo der song ste de dag la chos bshad do //
analyzed: kho bo der song ste de dag la chos bshad do //
translated: I went there and taught the Dharma to them.

original: de dag kho bos chos bshad pa la sri zhu mi byed /
analyzed: de dag kho bos chos bshad pa la sri zhu mi byed /
translated: They did not serve me when I taught the Dharma.

original: rna blags te mi nyan /
analyzed: rna blags te mi nyan /
translated: They did not listen with ears perked up.

original: kun tu shes par bya ba'i sems kyis mi gnas pa'i steng du kho bo la 'phya smod /🔽gad mos 'debs shing /
analyzed: kun tu shes par bya ba'i sems kyis mi gnas pa'i steng du kho bo la 'phya smod / gad mos 'debs shing /
translated: They laughed at me,

original: tshig rtsub po dag kyang brjod do //
analyzed: tshig rtsub po dag kyang brjod do //
translated: and they spoke harsh words to me.

original: der kho bos zla ba gsum du sems can de dag las 'ga' yang yongs su smin par bya ma nus te skyo bar gyur to //
analyzed: der kho bos zla ba gsum du sems can de dag las 'ga' yang yongs su smin par bya ma nus te skyo bar gyur to //
translated: For three months I was not able to ripen a single one of those beings. I became discouraged.

original: kho bo skyo bar gyur nas slar song ngo //
analyzed: kho bo skyo bar gyur nas slar song ngo //
translated: I left.

original: de la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas mu stegs can lnga brgya sprul te /
analyzed: de la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas mu stegs can lnga brgya sprul te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Youth, emanated five hundred tīrthikas,

original: bdag nyid slob dpon du bzhag nas 'khor lnga brgya dang / gcer bu ma'i bu bden pa po gang na ba der dong ste lhags pa dang / gcer bu ma'i bu bden pa po'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag btsal nas mdun du 'dug ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid slob dpon du bzhag nas 'khor lnga brgya dang / gcer bu ma'i bu bden pa po gang na ba der dong ste lhags pa dang / gcer bu ma'i bu bden pa po'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag btsal nas mdun du 'dug ste /
translated: and he himself became their master. With his retinue of five hundred, he went to where the son of the naked ascetics, Satyaka, was. When he arrived, he bowed his head at the feet of the son of the naked ascetics, Satyaka, and sat down in front of him.

original: gcer bu ma'i bu bden pa po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gcer bu ma'i bu bden pa po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He said to the son of the naked ascetics, Satyaka:

original: bdag cag gis 'phags pa'i grags pa'i sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa rgya chen po thos nas ljongs gzhan nas yangs pa can gyi grong khyer 'dir mchis te /🔽khyod ni kho bo cag gi ston pa'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis 'phags pa'i grags pa'i sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa rgya chen po thos nas ljongs gzhan nas yangs pa can gyi grong khyer 'dir mchis te / khyod ni kho bo cag gi ston pa'o //
translated: “We have come here to the city of Vaiśālī from other lands, having heard the vast and noble sounds of your fame and verses.🔽You are our teacher.

original: kho bo cag ni khyod kyi slong ma'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni khyod kyi slong ma'o //
translated: We are your disciples.

original: kho bo cag khyod las rjes su bstan pa nod do //
analyzed: kho bo cag khyod las rjes su bstan pa nod do //
translated: We receive your instructions.

original: @432b ci nas kyang dge sbyong goo ta ma de dang / de'i nyan thos rnams mi mthong ba dang / ci nas kyang de las mi mthun pa'i chos mi thos pa de ltar kho bo cag la mdzod cig /
analyzed: @432b ci nas kyang dge sbyong goo ta ma de dang / de'i nyan thos rnams mi mthong ba dang / ci nas kyang de las mi mthun pa'i chos mi thos pa de ltar kho bo cag la mdzod cig /
translated: Please do whatever you can so that we do not see the ascetic Gautama or his disciples, and so that we do not hear anything that is contrary to his teachings.”

original: gcer bu ma'i bu bden pa pos smras pa /
analyzed: gcer bu ma'i bu bden pa pos smras pa /
translated: The Jaina monk Satyaka said,

original: skyes bu dam pa dang / legs so //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dang / legs so //
translated: “Excellent, excellent, good man!

original: legs so // dad pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: legs so // dad pa dang ldan pa /
translated: Excellent, excellent, faithful one!

original: dad pa dang ldan pa khyod ring po mi thogs par nga'i chos bstan pa 'di shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa khyod ring po mi thogs par nga'i chos bstan pa 'di shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Faithful one, before long you will understand this Dharma teaching of mine.”

original: de nas gcer bu ma'i bu bden pa pos rang gi 'khor rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas gcer bu ma'i bu bden pa pos rang gi 'khor rnams la smras pa /
translated: Then the Jaina monk Satyaka said to his retinue,🔽“Gentlemen, do not say such things.

original: tshur shog / khyed cag bram ze'i bu lnga brgya po 'di dag dang lhan cig tu kun tu dga' ba dang / mthun pa dang / phan tshun chos la dpyad pa dpyod cing lhan cig tu gnas par gyis shig /
analyzed: tshur shog / khyed cag bram ze'i bu lnga brgya po 'di dag dang lhan cig tu kun tu dga' ba dang / mthun pa dang / phan tshun chos la dpyad pa dpyod cing lhan cig tu gnas par gyis shig /
translated: You should stay together with these five hundred young brahmins, delighting in each other, harmonizing with each other, and discussing the Dharma with each other.

original: 'di dag gis gang cung zad ci smras pa deng khyed kyis shin tu legs par gzung zhig /
analyzed: 'di dag gis gang cung zad ci smras pa deng khyed kyis shin tu legs par gzung zhig /
translated: Whatever they say, you should remember it well.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa /
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa /
translated: Then Mañjuśrī, the youthful one,

original: 'khor gcer bu pa lnga brgya sprul pa dang / gzhan mu stegs can gyi nyan thos rnams dang lhan cig tu 'dug nas /
analyzed: 'khor gcer bu pa lnga brgya sprul pa dang / gzhan mu stegs can gyi nyan thos rnams dang lhan cig tu 'dug nas /
translated: together with the five hundred emanated Nirgrantha followers and the hearers of other tīrthikas,

original: de dag gi dka' thub dang / brtul zhugs dang / spyod lam dang / bslab pa'i tshig ji tsam du rgyun mi 'chad pa de bas kyang bdag dang 'khor la lhag par ston to //
analyzed: de dag gi dka' thub dang / brtul zhugs dang / spyod lam dang / bslab pa'i tshig ji tsam du rgyun mi 'chad pa de bas kyang bdag dang 'khor la lhag par ston to //
translated: he taught them the austerities, observances, conduct, and precepts more than they had, and he also taught them to his retinue.

original: skabs skabs su dkon mchog gsum gyi bsngags pa brjod do //
analyzed: skabs skabs su dkon mchog gsum gyi bsngags pa brjod do //
translated: From time to time he praised the Three Jewels.

original: skabs skabs ni gcer bu ma'i bu bden pa po'i yang dag pa'i yon tan bsngags pa brjod de /🔽des de dag yid ches par byas nas dus gzhan dang / tshod gzhan zhig na mu stegs @433a *//
analyzed: skabs skabs ni gcer bu ma'i bu bden pa po'i yang dag pa'i yon tan bsngags pa brjod de / des de dag yid ches par byas nas dus gzhan dang / tshod gzhan zhig na mu stegs @433a *//
translated: At times he would praise the true qualities of the son of the naked ascetic Satyaka.

original: can gzhan tshogs pa la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: can gzhan tshogs pa la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: In this way he gained their trust, and at another time, when the assembly of non-Buddhists had gathered, Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
translated: “Venerable ones,

original: bdag cag gi bstan bcos pa dang / sngags dang; rig byed dang / gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin dge sbyong goo ta ma de'i yang dag pa'i yon tan bsngags pa yang yod do //
analyzed: bdag cag gi bstan bcos pa dang / sngags dang; rig byed dang / gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin dge sbyong goo ta ma de'i yang dag pa'i yon tan bsngags pa yang yod do //
translated: there are praises of the true qualities of that ascetic Gautama, in accordance with our treatises, mantras, Vedas, and scriptures.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar dge sbyong goo ta ma ni rigs phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge sbyong goo ta ma ni rigs phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: It is like this: The ascetic Gautama has a perfect family.

original: pha dang ma dag pa /
analyzed: pha dang ma dag pa /
translated: His father and mother are pure.

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rigs su skyes pa /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rigs su skyes pa /
translated: He was born into the family of a universal monarch.

original: bsod nams brgya'i mtshan dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bsod nams brgya'i mtshan dang ldan pa ste /
translated: He possesses the marks of a hundred merits.

original: btsas pa tsam na brgya byin dang / tshangs bas yongs su blangs shing /
analyzed: btsas pa tsam na brgya byin dang / tshangs bas yongs su blangs shing /
translated: As soon as he was born, he was received by Śakra and Brahmā.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yos /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yos /
translated: The world systems of a billion worlds shook in six ways.

original: ma bzung par gom pa bdun por te /
analyzed: ma bzung par gom pa bdun por te /
translated: Without being held, he took seven steps

original: tshig kyang nga ni 'jig rten gyi thu bo ste /
analyzed: tshig kyang nga ni 'jig rten gyi thu bo ste /
translated: and said, “I am the eldest in the world.

original: skye ba dang 'chi ba mthar bya'o zhes de skad smra zhing /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi ba mthar bya'o zhes de skad smra zhing /
translated: I will put an end to birth and death.”

original: chu'i rgyun gnyis byung ste /
analyzed: chu'i rgyun gnyis byung ste /
translated: Two streams of water flowed forth

original: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong bas khrus byas /
analyzed: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong bas khrus byas /
translated: and Śakra, Brahmā, and the world guardians bathed him.

original: lha'i dang mi'i rol mo dag kyang ma brdungs par sgra byung /
analyzed: lha'i dang mi'i rol mo dag kyang ma brdungs par sgra byung /
translated: Divine and human music sounded without being played.

original: des 'od gang gis ngan song thams cad so sor thar pa dang / bdud kyi gnas thams cad zil gyis gnon pa de lta bu'i 'od kyang btang ste /
analyzed: des 'od gang gis ngan song thams cad so sor thar pa dang / bdud kyi gnas thams cad zil gyis gnon pa de lta bu'i 'od kyang btang ste /
translated: He emitted a light that freed all beings in the lower realms and outshone all the abodes of Māra.

original: dbang po nyams pa thams cad kyang dbang po ma nyams par gyur /
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa thams cad kyang dbang po ma nyams par gyur /
translated: All those with impaired faculties became those with unimpaired faculties.

original: yud tsam de la sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad zhi ste mchog tu bde ba thob par gyur /
analyzed: yud tsam de la sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad zhi ste mchog tu bde ba thob par gyur /
translated: In that instant, all the afflictions of all beings were pacified and they attained supreme bliss.

original: bram @433b ze rig byed kyi cho ga shes pa rnams kyis kyang de ste khyim na 'dug na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bram @433b ze rig byed kyi cho ga shes pa rnams kyis kyang de ste khyim na 'dug na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: The brahmins who were skilled in the rites of the Vedas also proclaimed, ‘If he remains in the household, he will become a universal monarch.

original: de ste nags su song na chos kyi rgyal po sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bsgo ste /
analyzed: de ste nags su song na chos kyi rgyal po sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bsgo ste /
translated: If he goes to the forest, he will become a Dharma king, a buddha.’

original: de'i 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po bor nas rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: de'i 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po bor nas rab tu byung ste /
translated: He abandoned the life of a universal monarch and went forth.

original: des byang chub kyi snying por bdud kyi sde bye ba phrag brgya pa btul te byang chub thob /🔽des 'jig rten na dge sbyong ngam; bram ze'am /🔽lha'am / bdud dam /
analyzed: des byang chub kyi snying por bdud kyi sde bye ba phrag brgya pa btul te byang chub thob / des 'jig rten na dge sbyong ngam; bram ze'am / lha'am / bdud dam /
translated: He subdued the hordes of Māra, numbering in the hundreds of millions, at the site of awakening and attained awakening.🔽He turned the wheel of Dharma, which cannot be turned by any ascetic, brahmin, deva, māra,

original: tshangs pa'am / sus kyang chos dang mthun par bskor bar mi nus pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor /
analyzed: tshangs pa'am / sus kyang chos dang mthun par bskor bar mi nus pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor /
translated: Brahmā, or anyone else in the world in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de chos kyang ston te /
analyzed: de chos kyang ston te /
translated: He taught the Dharma:

original: tshangs par spyod pa /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa /
translated: the pure life,

original: thog mar dge ba /🔽bar du dge ba /
analyzed: thog mar dge ba / bar du dge ba /
translated: which is virtuous in the beginning,🔽virtuous in the middle,

original: tha mar dge ba /
analyzed: tha mar dge ba /
translated: and virtuous in the end;

original: don bzang po /
analyzed: don bzang po /
translated: which has excellent meaning

original: tshig 'bru bzang po /
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po /
translated: and excellent words;

original: ma 'dres pa /🔽yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa / yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: which is unadulterated;🔽which is perfect;

original: yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa /
translated: and which is pure.

original: yongs su byang ba /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba /
translated: It is completely purified.🔽🔽

original: yang dag par rab tu ston to //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu ston to //
translated: He teaches it completely and perfectly.

original: de la de'i nyan thos dag gi thog mar dge ba de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la de'i nyan thos dag gi thog mar dge ba de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “The first virtue of his disciples is this:

original: lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang / ngag gi legs par spyod pa dang / yid kyi legs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang / ngag gi legs par spyod pa dang / yid kyi legs par spyod pa'o //
translated: good conduct of body, good conduct of speech, and good conduct of mind.

original: bar du dge ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems dang / shes rab la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bar du dge ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems dang / shes rab la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The middle virtue is the training in higher morality, higher thought, and higher wisdom.

original: tha mar dge ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: tha mar dge ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
translated: The last virtue is the door of liberation by emptiness, the door of liberation by signlessness, and the door of liberation by wishlessness.

original: gzhan yang thog mar dge ba ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang thog mar dge ba ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa'o //
translated: “Moreover, the first virtue is aspiration, striving, and heedfulness.

original: bar du dge ba ni dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / sems rtse gcig @434a *//
analyzed: bar du dge ba ni dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / sems rtse gcig @434a *//
translated: The middle virtue is mindfulness, concentration, and one-pointedness of mind.

original: pa'o // tha mar dge ba ni shes rab dang / lhag mthong dang / ye shes so //
analyzed: pa'o // tha mar dge ba ni shes rab dang / lhag mthong dang / ye shes so //
translated: The last virtue is wisdom, insight, and knowledge.

original: gzhan yang thogs mar dge ba ni sangs rgyas la mi phyed par dad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang thogs mar dge ba ni sangs rgyas la mi phyed par dad pa'o //
translated: “Moreover, the first virtue is unshakable faith in the Buddha.

original: bar du dge ba ni chos la mi phyed par dad pa'o //
analyzed: bar du dge ba ni chos la mi phyed par dad pa'o //
translated: The middle virtue is the undivided faith in the Dharma.

original: tha mar dge ba ni dge 'dun la mi phyed par dad pas 'bras bu thob pa'o //
analyzed: tha mar dge ba ni dge 'dun la mi phyed par dad pas 'bras bu thob pa'o //
translated: The final virtue is the undivided faith in the Saṅgha, which is the attainment of the fruit.

original: gzhan yang thog mar dge ba ni gzhan las nyan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang thog mar dge ba ni gzhan las nyan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the initial virtue is listening to the Dharma from another.

original: bar du dge ba ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: bar du dge ba ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The middle virtue is proper mental attention.

original: tha mar dge ba ni 'phags pa'i yang dag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: tha mar dge ba ni 'phags pa'i yang dag par lta ba'o //
translated: The final virtue is the noble ones’ right view.

original: gzhan yang thog mar dge ba ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spang ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang thog mar dge ba ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spang ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the initial virtue is the thorough knowledge of suffering and the abandonment of its origin.

original: bar du dge ba ni lam bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bar du dge ba ni lam bsgom pa'o //
translated: The middle virtue is the cultivation of the path.

original: tha mar dge ba ni 'gog pa mngon sum du byed pa ste /
analyzed: tha mar dge ba ni 'gog pa mngon sum du byed pa ste /
translated: The final virtue is the realization of cessation.

original: 'di dag ni nyan thos rnams kyi thog mar dge ba dang / bar du dge ba dang / tha mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nyan thos rnams kyi thog mar dge ba dang / bar du dge ba dang / tha mar dge ba'o //
translated: These are the initial virtue, the middle virtue, and the final virtue of the disciples.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thog mar dge ba dang / bar du dge ba dang / tha mar dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thog mar dge ba dang / bar du dge ba dang / tha mar dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the initial virtue, the middle virtue, and the final virtue of the bodhisattvas?

original: de la thog mar dge ba ni byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de la thog mar dge ba ni byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba'o //
translated: The first virtue is not to abandon the thought of awakening.

original: bar du dge ba ni theg pa dman pa mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bar du dge ba ni theg pa dman pa mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: The middle virtue is not to desire the Lesser Vehicle.

original: tha mar dge ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: tha mar dge ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: The last virtue is to dedicate everything to omniscience.

original: gzhan yang thog mar dge ba ni sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pas byams pa chen po'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang thog mar dge ba ni sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pas byams pa chen po'o //
translated: Moreover, the first virtue is great love, which is to have an attitude of impartiality toward all sentient beings.

original: bar du dge ba ni sems can thams cad la bya ba ji yod snyam pas snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: bar du dge ba ni sems can thams cad la bya ba ji yod snyam pas snying rje chen po'o //
translated: The middle virtue is great compassion, which is to think about what needs to be done for all sentient beings.

original: @434b tha mar dge ba ni dga' ba dang / btang snyoms mnyam pa'i sems kyis nges par sems pa'o //
analyzed: @434b tha mar dge ba ni dga' ba dang / btang snyoms mnyam pa'i sems kyis nges par sems pa'o //
translated: The last virtue is to be certain in one’s attitude of equanimity, joy, and so forth.

original: gzhan yang thog mar dge ba ni ser sna'i sems tshar gcod pa dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims spong ba dang / gnod sems sel ba dang / le lo spong ba dang / rnam par g-yeng ba kun tu mi spyod pa dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab spong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang thog mar dge ba ni ser sna'i sems tshar gcod pa dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims spong ba dang / gnod sems sel ba dang / le lo spong ba dang / rnam par g-yeng ba kun tu mi spyod pa dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab spong ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the first virtue is to eliminate the attitude of stinginess, to abandon immorality, to eliminate malice, to abandon laziness, to not engage in distraction, and to abandon false wisdom.

original: bar du dge ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bar du dge ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The middle virtue is the completion of the accumulations of giving, morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom.

original: tha mar dge ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: tha mar dge ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: The final virtue is the completion of the six perfections and the dedication to omniscience.

original: gzhan yang thog mar dge ba ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang thog mar dge ba ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the initial virtue is the maturation of sentient beings through the four means of attraction.

original: bar du dge ba ni lus dang srog la mi lta bar dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bar du dge ba ni lus dang srog la mi lta bar dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The middle virtue is the upholding of the holy Dharma without regard for body and life.

original: tha mar dge ba ni skyon med par ltung ba'i 'jigs pa las srung ba'o //🔽gzhan yang thog mar dge ba ni sems dang mtshungs pa mi gtong bas /
analyzed: tha mar dge ba ni skyon med par ltung ba'i 'jigs pa las srung ba'o // gzhan yang thog mar dge ba ni sems dang mtshungs pa mi gtong bas /
translated: The final virtue is the protection from the fear of falling into the unwholesome states.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the initial virtue is the bodhisattva conduct, which is never abandoned because it is equal to the mind.

original: bar du dge ba ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i shes pas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: bar du dge ba ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i shes pas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa'o //
translated: The middle virtue is the stage of non-returning through the knowledge of engagement and disengagement.

original: tha mar dge ba ni dbang thob pas skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ste /
analyzed: tha mar dge ba ni dbang thob pas skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ste /
translated: The final virtue is the one that is attained by the bodhisattva who has received empowerment and is only one birth away from buddhahood.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thog mar dge ba dang / bar du dge ba dang / tha mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thog mar dge ba dang / bar du dge ba dang / tha mar dge ba'o //
translated: These are the initial, intermediate, and final virtues of the bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa @435a *//🔽gzhan mu stegs can gyi 'khor de na /
analyzed: de ltar 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa @435a *// gzhan mu stegs can gyi 'khor de na /
translated: In this way, Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta🔽taught the Dharma to the assembly of non-Buddhists

original: de lta de ltar chos ston te /
analyzed: de lta de ltar chos ston te /
translated: in that place.

original: gzhan mu stegs can lnga brgya ni chos kyi mig rdul med cing /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can lnga brgya ni chos kyi mig rdul med cing /
translated: Five hundred non-Buddhists purified the eye of Dharma,

original: dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
translated: free from dust and stainless.

original: gzhan mu stegs can brgyad stong ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can brgyad stong ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: Eight thousand non-Buddhists gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de nas sprul pa lnga brgya po de dag gis yan lag lnga sa la gtugs te phyag btsal nas /🔽tshig tu'ang sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de nas sprul pa lnga brgya po de dag gis yan lag lnga sa la gtugs te phyag btsal nas / tshig tu'ang sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Then, those five hundred emanations prostrated, touching their five limbs to the ground,🔽and exclaimed, “Homage to the Buddha!

original: sangs rgyas la 'tshal lo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la 'tshal lo zhes brjod do //
translated: Homage to the Buddha!”

original: de dag gi rjes su slob pa'i tshul gyis gzhan mu stegs can gyi 'khor de dag thams cad kyis kyang yan lag lnga sa la gtugs te phyag btsal nas /🔽tshig tu'ang sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su slob pa'i tshul gyis gzhan mu stegs can gyi 'khor de dag thams cad kyis kyang yan lag lnga sa la gtugs te phyag btsal nas / tshig tu'ang sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: After them, all the other tīrthika retinues also bowed down to the Blessed One by touching their five points to the ground.🔽They also said, “Homage to the Buddha!

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes brjod do //
translated: Homage to the Buddha!”

original: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis kyang de dag la khyed 'dis bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byos shig ces me tog mand'a ra ba dag byin no ////
analyzed: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis kyang de dag la khyed 'dis bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byos shig ces me tog mand'a ra ba dag byin no ////
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, gave them mandārava flowers, saying, “With these, you should make offerings to the Blessed One.”🔽The fourth chapter, the last.

original: bum po bzhi pa ste tha ma; de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa 'khor mang pos yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te /
analyzed: bum po bzhi pa ste tha ma; de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa 'khor mang pos yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te /
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, surrounded and venerated by a great retinue,

original: smig ma'i ldum bu'i 'khor gyi khyams ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong nas lhags pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag btsal nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: smig ma'i ldum bu'i 'khor gyi khyams ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong nas lhags pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag btsal nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: went to the Sūkarāvadana Grove and to where the Blessed One was. Upon arrival, he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: gzhan mu stegs can gyi 'khor de dag @435b gis kyang me tog mand'a ra ba de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas nas bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas te /

original: phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sprul pa lnga brgya po de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //

translated: When they saw that, they turned back.

original: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba ga la ba dang / smig ma'i ldum bu'i 'khor gyi khyams ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba @439b der dong ste lhags pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag btsal nas /
analyzed: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba ga la ba dang / smig ma'i ldum bu'i 'khor gyi khyams ga la ba dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba @439b der dong ste lhags pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag btsal nas /
translated: They bowed their heads at the Blessed One’s feet,

original: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: circumambulated him three times, and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'khod pa dang / de dag la kho bos 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'khod pa dang / de dag la kho bos 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When they had sat to one side, I said to them,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /🔽gar dong dong /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag / gar dong dong /
translated: “Venerable ones,

original: gang nas 'ongs /
analyzed: gang nas 'ongs /
translated: where have you come from?🔽Where are you going?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: kho bo cag ni dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa /
translated: we are arhats whose defilements have ceased,

original: bsam gtan thob pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan thob pa /
translated: we have attained concentration,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i pha rol tu son pa ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i pha rol tu son pa ste /
translated: and we have perfected the bases of supernatural power.

original: kho bo cag 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa 'di las mi mthun pa'i chos bshad pa thos nas stan las langs te dong na /
analyzed: kho bo cag 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa 'di las mi mthun pa'i chos bshad pa thos nas stan las langs te dong na /
translated: I heard the youthful Mañjuśrī expound the Dharma of non-duality, and then I rose from my seat and left.

original: kho bo cag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di thams cad mes yongs su gang bar mthong ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di thams cad mes yongs su gang bar mthong ste /
translated: I saw this entire buddha realm filled with fire.

original: me'i phung po de las brgal bar ma nus so //
analyzed: me'i phung po de las brgal bar ma nus so //
translated: I was unable to cross over that mass of fire.

original: kho bos bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: kho bos bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: I asked the Blessed One,

original: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'i sa de gang lags /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'i sa de gang lags /
translated: ‘What is the level of the arhat who has exhausted the defilements?’

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi kho bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi kho bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to me,

original: gang po / gang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang; gti mug gi me la spyod pas me'i phung po las 'da' ba ni gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: gang po / gang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang; gti mug gi me la spyod pas me'i phung po las 'da' ba ni gnas ma yin no //
translated: ‘Pūrṇa, it is not possible to cross over a mass of fire by engaging in the fire of desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: lta ba'i dra bas bsgribs pas lcags kyi dra ba bcad pa dang / sred pa'i chur zhugs pas chu'i phung po las brgal ba ni gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba'i dra bas bsgribs pas lcags kyi dra ba bcad pa dang / sred pa'i chur zhugs pas chu'i phung po las brgal ba ni gnas ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to cut through the net of views that obscures one or to cross over the mass of water by entering the water of craving.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang po / 'di ltar dge slong 'di dag 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me la spyod de /🔽de dag me'i @440a *//
analyzed: gang po / 'di ltar dge slong 'di dag 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me la spyod de / de dag me'i @440a *//
translated: Pūrṇa, these bhikṣus are engaged in the fire of desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: phung po chen po las 'da' bar mi nus so //
analyzed: phung po chen po las 'da' bar mi nus so //
translated: They are unable to transcend the great mass of fire.

original: de dag lta ba'i dra bas bsgribs te /
analyzed: de dag lta ba'i dra bas bsgribs te /
translated: They are obscured by the net of views.

original: lcags kyi dra ba gcad par mi nus so //
analyzed: lcags kyi dra ba gcad par mi nus so //
translated: They are unable to cut through the iron net.

original: de dag sred pa'i chu bor zhugs te /
analyzed: de dag sred pa'i chu bor zhugs te /
translated: They have entered the river of craving.

original: chu'i phung po las rgal bar mi nus so //
analyzed: chu'i phung po las rgal bar mi nus so //
translated: They are unable to cross the mass of water.

original: gang po / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang po / 'di lta ste /
translated: Pūrṇa, it is like this:

original: dper na / me'i phung po gang yin pa dang / lcags kyi dra ba gang yin pa dang / chu'i phung po gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
analyzed: dper na / me'i phung po gang yin pa dang / lcags kyi dra ba gang yin pa dang / chu'i phung po gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
translated: The mass of fire, the iron net, and the mass of water—all those phenomena do not come from anywhere

original: gang du'ang ma song ste /
analyzed: gang du'ang ma song ste /
translated: and do not go anywhere.

original: gzhan du na 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis snang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis snang ngo //
translated: Other than that, they appear through the blessing of the youthful Mañjuśrī.

original: gang po / de bzhin du 'dod chags dang; zhe sdang dang / gti mug gang yin pa dang / lta bar byas pa gang yin pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa gang yin pa'i chos de dag gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
analyzed: gang po / de bzhin du 'dod chags dang; zhe sdang dang / gti mug gang yin pa dang / lta bar byas pa gang yin pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa gang yin pa'i chos de dag gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
translated: Pūrṇa, in the same way, the phenomena of desire, anger, and ignorance, the views that are formed, and the craving for existence do not come from anywhere.

original: gang du'ang ma song ste /
analyzed: gang du'ang ma song ste /
translated: Pūrṇa, in the same way, desire, anger, and ignorance, whatever is made into a view, and the craving for existence, these dharmas do not come from anywhere or go anywhere.

original: gzhan du na phyin ci log sngon du 'gro ba'i rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa las bdag po med pa /
analyzed: gzhan du na phyin ci log sngon du 'gro ba'i rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa las bdag po med pa /
translated: Other than that, from the prior occurrence of error, from conceptualization, from discursive thought, from imagination, without a master,

original: bdag gi med pa /
analyzed: bdag gi med pa /
translated: without a self,

original: yongs su gzung ba med pa'i bdag dang gzhan du sgro 'dogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba med pa'i bdag dang gzhan du sgro 'dogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: without appropriation, the superimposition of self and other occurs.

original: de la rnal 'byor pa rnal 'byor spyod pas rnam par g-yengs ba'i sems rtse gcig tu byed do //
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor pa rnal 'byor spyod pas rnam par g-yengs ba'i sems rtse gcig tu byed do //
translated: There, the yogin, the practitioner, unifies the distracted mind.

original: sems rtse gcig pas zhi gnas sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pas zhi gnas sgrub par byed do //
translated: By unifying the mind, he accomplishes śamatha.

original: zhi gnas kyi tshogs kyis bsam gtan skyed par byed do //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi tshogs kyis bsam gtan skyed par byed do //
translated: By the accumulation of śamatha, he generates dhyāna.

original: bsam gtan thob pas kyang rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan thob pas kyang rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: Even by attaining dhyāna, he does not become conceited.

original: mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
analyzed: mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
translated: He does not become attached.

original: bsam gtan las su rung bar @440b byas pa'i sems kyis kyang chos rnams la rnam par lta ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan las su rung bar @440b byas pa'i sems kyis kyang chos rnams la rnam par lta ste /
translated: With a mind that is fit for meditative concentration, he also observes phenomena.

original: chos gang gi rgyu dang / rkyen du 'gyur zhes de so sor rtog pa na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog par byed de /
analyzed: chos gang gi rgyu dang / rkyen du 'gyur zhes de so sor rtog pa na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog par byed de /
translated: When he examines which phenomena are the causes and conditions of other phenomena, he examines them in accordance with reality.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: In this way,

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
translated: through the condition of ignorance, there are formations.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
translated: Through the condition of formations, there is consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
translated: Through the condition of consciousness, there is name and form.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug /
translated: Through the condition of name and form, there are the six sense sources.

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa /🔽reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
translated: Through the condition of the six sense sources, there is contact.🔽Through the condition of contact, there is feeling.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
translated: Through the condition of feeling, there is craving.

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /🔽len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
translated: Through the condition of craving, there is grasping.🔽Through the condition of grasping, there is becoming.

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
translated: Through the condition of becoming, there is birth.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: grief, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, this entire great mass of suffering comes into being.

original: 'di ni log par bsgrub pa'i 'du byed kyi lam zhes bya'o //🔽ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag /
analyzed: 'di ni log par bsgrub pa'i 'du byed kyi lam zhes bya'o // ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag /
translated: This is called the path of formative factors that are wrongly cultivated.🔽When ignorance ceases, formative factors cease.

original: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag /
analyzed: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag /
translated: When formative factors cease, consciousness ceases.

original: rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag /
translated: When consciousness ceases, name and form cease.

original: ming dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag /
translated: When name and form cease, the six sense spheres cease.

original: skye mched drug 'gags pas reg pa 'gag /
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gags pas reg pa 'gag /
translated: When the six sense spheres cease, contact ceases.

original: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag /
analyzed: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag /
translated: When contact ceases, feeling ceases.

original: tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag /
analyzed: tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag /
translated: When feeling ceases, craving ceases.

original: sred pa 'gags pas len pa 'gag /
analyzed: sred pa 'gags pas len pa 'gag /
translated: When craving ceases, grasping ceases.

original: len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag /
analyzed: len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag /
translated: When grasping ceases, existence ceases.

original: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba @441a *//
analyzed: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba @441a *//
translated: When existence ceases, birth ceases.

original: 'gag / skye ba 'gags pas rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'gag ste /
analyzed: 'gag / skye ba 'gags pas rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'gag ste /
translated: When birth ceases, old age, death, grief, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation cease.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, this entire great mass of suffering ceases.

original: 'di ni yang dag par sgrub pa 'dus ma byas su nges par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par sgrub pa 'dus ma byas su nges par 'jug pa'o //
translated: This is the correct practice that definitely enters the unconditioned.

original: de la ma rig pa 'gags pa ni 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa 'gags pa ni 'das pa ma yin /
translated: Regarding this, the cessation of ignorance is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: not future,

original: de ltar byung ba ma yin mod kyi /🔽'on kyang gang tshul bzhin ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar byung ba ma yin mod kyi / 'on kyang gang tshul bzhin ma yin mod kyi /
translated: and not present.

original: 'on kyang gang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa byung bas ma rig pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa byung bas ma rig pa 'byung ste /
translated: However, when there is incorrect mental activity, ignorance arises.

original: de tshul bzhin yid la byed pas so sor rtog pa yid la byed na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tshul bzhin yid la byed pas so sor rtog pa yid la byed na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is correct mental activity and discernment, it does not arise.

original: mi 'byung ba de ni shin tu 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'byung ba de ni shin tu 'gags pa ste /
translated: When it does not arise, it is completely ceased.

original: de bas na ma rig pa 'gag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ma rig pa 'gag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Ignorance ceases.”

original: de la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba'i lus 'di la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba'i lus 'di la 'di lta ste /
translated: “Correct mental activity” means to discern the body that arises from the four great elements as follows:

original: lus 'di ni bems po ste /
analyzed: lus 'di ni bems po ste /
translated: “This body is inanimate,

original: rtsva dang / shing dang / rtsig pa dang / rdo ltar snang bar so sor rtog go /🔽gang sems sam /
analyzed: rtsva dang / shing dang / rtsig pa dang / rdo ltar snang bar so sor rtog go / gang sems sam /
translated: like grass, trees, walls, and stones.”

original: yid dam / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de'ang gzugs med pa /
analyzed: yid dam / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de'ang gzugs med pa /
translated: “That which is called mind, thought, or consciousness is formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: cannot be shown,

original: thogs pa med pa /🔽rnam par mi rig pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa /🔽rnam par mi rig pa /
translated: is without obstruction,🔽and is non-apprehending.
